title: You're not going to want to pass this up.
text:
Hey you. Now that I've got your attention, let me tell you why I'm the guy you're on Craigslist Personals to find. I'm that dude. ;)
Now, you might not believe it but you're on the verge of sitting down and writing a letter to a real deal, bonafied Prisoner of War. Seriously. As Americans lose more and more of our rights, more and more Americans are taking a stand. I'm one of them. I stood for my rights, for ALL of our rights; I put my life on the line and, recently, I was given a Life sentence for it. Basically it was a shootout between myself and Marion County's SWAT team, though I must say, I shot up their Armored Vehicle. I never tried to hurt or kill any of them. I shot up their BearCat as a warning to NOT come into my house and force me to defend myself.
Anyway, not only am I "that dude," but in all likelihood I'm going to come out of this smelling like a rose. I filed a lawsuit a few months after all this happened. See, after I surrendered they beat the crap out of me. Well, so far, one officer has admitted in federal court to my allegations and he's testified that at least 2 other officers were involved.
So to sum all this up, I have a temporary Life sentence for standing up for my rights. This'll be overturned within the next year or two. And I have a rock solid lawsuit. Until all of this comes to fruition, I'm looking to network and get to know people. So what are you waiting for? Get to writing! Don't be shy; just be yourself and let's get acquainted. Talk to you soon.
-Dustin
Respond to this post via email and I'll give you the address to write to.

title: YOU ARE SHY, SMART AND (JUST A LITTLE) INHIBITED
text:
I am an intellectual man, seeking a smart girl,
one for whom high school is not a distant memory...
shy, but smart,
sexual, but inhibited.
My desire is for fun...
but hers is for freedom from uncertainty.


... at night... in the safety of your bed,
as sleep begins its encroachment,
you imagine yourself on an endless sea,
vast and exciting,
the wind at your back...
your sails bellow with the wind of optimism.
Were it only that your craft was not rudderless...
were it only that your forward momentum was not hindered
by inhibition's dispatch of an insidious and persistent anchor.
You imagine him there... with you...
his hands going where yours now find themselves...
moving... penetrating... and in the end leading you to sleep.


(as you, i too have found myself adrift...
my wayward floundering vanquished by a random soulmate,
often older,
wiser,
always offering the security i needed,
the comfort i desired...
but most importantly
the ability to free the person i knew was inside of me,
begging for release from the prison of doubt that somehow, 
through no fault of my own, was manufactured within my being).

Write me, even if you are just curious.

If you don't know what I'm talking about take a quick look and you'll see what I mean. Hoping to find some sense of normal here. 

I'll start by saying I'm attached, maybe you are too, and although I'm not looking to change my situation, still have needs that aren't being met. I'm 35, tall, handsome, successful, in good shape, college educated, respectful and even though I'm not looking for what would be a typical LTR I am looking for an ongoing, monogamous +1 relationship where you have the freedom to find Mr. Right but at the same time have your needs met and make a fun, new friend you actually enjoy spending time with :) If you've spent any time looking for love on CL I can't even imagine what kind of replies you must get! Let's hope I'm your needle in the haystack ;)

You should be in good shape as I am, intelligent, mature, not into hard drugs, able to host, on birth control, have an open mind and be ok with my situation and truly looking for a good friend you can unleash your pent up desires with. I'm open to age and status as long and as long as you meet the criteria above I'd love to hear from you! I must say I have a thing for younger women but if you're intrigued by anything of what I've said send me a reply!

Oh, and to answer the title, and probably a shit poor analogy, but it's kind of like buying a vibrator, except this one's A LOT more fun, doesn't need batteries and won't make your arm sore, lol, :)

title: LTR with Age Difference
text:
You know who you are. You know what you need. You know what you like. You have high expectations when it comes to men (even here on CL).

Older men intrigue you--professional, established, sophisticated older men. They have something to say. They have an understated kind of confidence. Their maturity is a turn on. Women mature at a faster rate then men and you have tired of the insecurities and games that the man-boys your age play.

Personally, you'd love having not just a partner and lover but also an older mentor and teacher. It is exhausting keeping your defenses up and playing silly dating games. With an older man a certain kind of soft submissiveness within you would shine through and you could retreat into a very personal, nurturing and sensual world.

Admittedly, there is a pronounced "little girl" inside you that wants to be adored and coddled. That same "little girl" also needs to sometimes have her bullshit called and have some discipline and direction instilled into her world. Guys your age can't do that. They are still figuring out who they are, and don't have the insights, nerve and confidence to keep you properly on task.

When you look in the mirror you see these two sides of you. One side is the pretty, educated/smart young woman who has the world by the balls. The other side is the softer, searching "little girl" who wants and needs an older man as an integral part of her life.

I am handsome, accomplished, sincere and not looking for this to be some silly little one-off fantasy date but instead something that grows into a very deep connection.

title: Love is the beauty of the soul
text:
Love! Who doesn't dream of falling in love? Finding that one person who makes our heart skip a beat every time they call or walk into the room. Some of us have had it and ended up with our hearts broken. I know this to be true because it's happened to me. Let's face it, love is not a science or perfect. You have to have trust and honesty. You have to communicate and talk with one another. You have to be faithful and loyal. IF you can do that then you can fall in love. That's what I want. I want to fall in love. I want to find my best friend, companion, and forever lover.

Yeah, I know there has to be some sort of physical attraction. Let's face it, though. If you look for someone solely based on looks then you're a shallow person. I am not shallow and have no desire to talk to anyone who is.

That said, greetings, my name is Niko. I am a hard working, motivated, 36 year old single guy with no children. I was born in Sicily in March of '79. My family moved to this country when I was 4. I've been in Minnesota since I was 11. I have a great full-time job as a lead carpenter. I make a very good living, have my own car, and am financially responsible. I love the outdoors, road trips or just doing simple little things for fun. Life is all about experiences. I am a hopeless romantic and know how a woman should be treated. I have a big heart and wear it on my sleeve. I have a lot of love to give to the right woman. I'd really like to connect with someone and learn about them.

I've been stood up several times. I won't let that bring me down. I want to make it clear that I am not looking for a hookup or fwb. I am a genuine man who is looking to fall in love.

Distance is not an issue, unless it's like 2 hours away. Oh and please don't waste my time. I'm not playing games here. I'm looking for a real relationship.

title: Intelligent nerd looking for love.
text:
I've been sitting here for twenty minutes trying to figure out how to write this without sounding generic, and I've been failing amazingly at it. I keep writing and rewriting, and I still can't seem to put the right words together. Other people here seem to know exactly what they want. Some at least have an idea. Some write small novels. Others still are satisfied putting just the basics. And the rest, well, they're in the flipping wrong category anyway. 

I'm looking for the right person. That's all I'm looking for. 

I want someone who I can laugh with, talk about nothing for hours with. I want someone who can understand me for who I am, and who I strive to be. I want someone who I have that connection that need not be spoken. I want someone who I can listen to, someone who can confide in me, just as I hope to be able to confide in them. I'm a romantic at heart, and, thing is, I'm the sort of person that thinks with his heart a lot of the time. 

See how I had that issue with sounding generic, cheesy? That sounded like a card or something, even though it was true. 

The simple facts? I'm in school full time, third shift mostly. I like my job, even with its ups and downs. I drive, own my own vehicle, don't live with my parents. Shorter hair, hazel eyes, glasses, fit. Working on getting ink'd. I'm the sort that believes that chivalry is not dead, just needs to be modernized. (Made sense, I swear.). Also, here is the kicker.....I live in Sioux Falls, SD. It's a 3 hour drive; however, if things became serious...I would make the drive weekly.

I'm a gamer. I'm a geek. Super geek. Not basement-dwelling geek. Just. Geek. I can be a goofball at times. (Favorite shows? Supernatural, Doctor Who, Firefly & more. Favorite Games? Mass Effect, Skyrim, and so many more.) Yeah, I play Dungeons and Dragons, but I don't dress in chain mail and throw bean bags at people yelling out spells. Though now that I type that out, it sounds sort of random and fun. All around geek/nerd here. 

What I'm looking for is to meet someone, hopefully have it turn into something more. I'm not one for friends with benefits, nor casual encounters. I'm looking for a best friend, my partner in crime, and all those things. Cuddles are nice too, just, ah, saying. Honestly too, looks, do matter to me. But I love people for who they are. I do hope, though, to find a fellow geek, or someone who has somewhat similar interests as I do. 

Please if you respond put your favorite show or game in the title, and tell me a bit about you. One line responses won't get replies, sorry. I took the time to write all this, I hope to get a bit from you too. I will want to text for a while, just to talk and such, so if I respond I'll send my number. Pic for pic and all that.

title: Uncertainty: hard-to-stomach fact #17
text:
Well, one would think that after 40-some years of facing the same reality, that one would eventually become accustomed to certain unassailable facts about it.

So why, then, is it so surprising, so raw, and so new, every time?

I speak, of course, of having a broken heart...

And what's the deal with yearning for someone long after they've made it clear that they want
nothing whatsoever to do with you?

What was it that Pascal said.... hmm... I think it was something to this effect:

"Love has its own reasons, of which reason itself is entirely unaware."

Anyhow, I'm clearly a good candidate for another broken heart. I seem to enjoy them.

(...& this may seem glib or sarcastic, but I think there must be a kernel of truth in it. After all, nothing makes one feel quite so alive as a broken heart.)

So please, get in touch! I seem to be in need of a new woman in my life.

-Max

"When your bow is broken
and your last arrow spent---
shoot! Shoot with all your heart."

-Anonymous

p.s. I will show you a pic of myself after we've begun communicating.

title: Does my soulmate happen to be living in the twin cities?
text:
Hello ladies! I realize this ad is long but if you're looking for the same thing I am, it should be appreciated rather than an inconvenience. The more you can learn about me upfront, the better. What I'm hoping to find is my future wife, plain and simple and I don't care how far and wide I have to search as long as there's a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow! I'm finally at the stage where I realize, there's nothing more important on earth than waking up every morning with the person you're supposed to be with. That would make this life's journey so much more fulfilling and definitely easier than tackling the world on your own. I would even take that over winning the lottery because the fact is, a lot of rich people are lonely. Don't get me wrong, I'm not looking to run out and elope tomorrow because I'm a little more realistic than that! Relationships take time to develop and futures have to be carefully planned out but I do want someone who's ready to settle down and is willing to take a chance. This means you're not afraid to put your heart on the table. Some would say that Craigslist is the last place a person should hope to find their soul mate but why not? You're on here, I'm on here and doesn't everyone else who gets on here shop at the same grocery stores we do? Considering those facts, who cares where you meet someone as long as you're compatible? We can always tell our friends and family that we met at the produce section!

I decided to start off by creating a list of "must haves". The idea was to go back in time and reminisce about the experiences I had from my past relationships. I thought about what worked for me, what didn't and ended up putting together a top 5 list. Please pay equal attention to all of it because each category is very important to me and they are things I can't live without. I truly believe that if we agree on the whole 1-5 list, we'll probably be successful but I also feel that if just one of them are missing, we won't stand a chance. I don't know about you, but I'm tired of wasting years of my life away with the wrong partners. Most of the women I've dated in the past have been out of convenience which is the route a lot of people take. Either we happened to live right next door to each other, worked together or got set up through mutual friends but I've never actually been with anyone that I got to pick out for myself. More often than not, the best things in life don't come easy and you can't expect them to fall into your lap. If you want to find something that's going to be real and lasting, it's probably going to require some work to get it with the same passion and commitment that you should put into a relationship. With that being said, my efforts are going towards getting the woman I want this time around and I'm not going to settle for less! 

Now onto my 1-5 list...

#1. COMMUNICATION - This is at the very top of my list. I don't care how attracted you are to each other, how much you have in common or how great the chemistry is between you. If you can't problem solve, your relationship has no where to go. It's as simple as that. What this requires is having the ability to convey what's wrong in a tactful manner, the willingness to compromise and a forgiving spirit whenever problems arise because you can rest assure they will! Those who can't do this end up being single or in and out of relationships their entire lives. I also think that never going to bed angry is a great policy to have! You might not be ready to talk out your differences yet, but you can at least wave a white flag and end the fight so the both of you can get a good night's sleep. Then you can work it out the next day after everything has calmed down. That's so much better than lying there all night pissed off with your heart racing isn't it? One thing leads into another and the next thing you know, you're having trouble functioning the next day at work because you're tired and still upset. It's not worth it. Some people actually think it's cool to be stubborn but on the contrary, it's a good way to age faster and find yourself alone in the end. 

#2. SEX - I think it's safe to say that I'm not like most men in this area! For one thing, I don't have much of an interest in strip clubs, porn or dirty magazines which eliminates at least 50% of the male population! However, if those things turn my lady on, I'll be happy to explore them with her but never on my own. In addition to that, I don't cheat or desire other women when I already have one nor do I fantasize about having a menage a trios with two girls. That takes care of the other 50%! I don't really like being the center of attention because my personality is more along the lines of a pleaser who's unselfish in bed. In other words, I'd rather focus on fulfilling your needs than my own. To give you an idea, there have been occasions when I've made a girl cum a couple of times but then quit without taking care of myself. If I know that you're finished and past the point of enjoyment, I try not to overdo it! Don't get me wrong because I do get mine in most of the time, but I will always put you first. Also, what I don't get about most people is that they do all of their experimenting while they're single. They would rather explore their sexuality with "casual acquaintances" than with their soulmate. Then when they finally settle down, they make their marriages boring as hell! It becomes the same old stale routine day after day which often leads to someone cheating. It doesn't make any sense at all. I think the fun stuff should be done with the person you're going to spend the rest of your life with! That's who you should be opening up to about your sexual desires. Maybe marriages would last longer if that were the case. With that being said, everyone has their fetishes and things that turn them on the most. Mine happens to be watching my lady get fucked by another guy! There's nothing hotter on earth than that and it's a huge aphrodisiac for me. It took me years to figure this out about myself and then I had to learn to accept it but now that I have, I want my future wife to enjoy this perk! In fact, it's very important to me that I find a woman who desires this very thing. Don't get me wrong, I'm not looking for a girl who's going to be promiscuous and sleep with every Tom, Dick and Harry that comes along, but I will definitely let you explore your sexuality and enjoy being a woman! I'm even open to finding a regular who we can pick out together and call up whenever the mood arises for a little extra fun! As long as there are no pregnancies, diseases or emotional attachments, this could be a healthy addition to our bedroom life! There's a big difference between having sex and making love. I'm willing to share my woman's body but not her heart, mind or affection. Those are things I want all to myself! Honesty is the key here and if everything is out on the table, lying and cheating should never become an issue.

#3. QUALITY TIME - I don't understand couples who live under the same roof and merely co-exist together. They barely even talk to each other and just go through the motions every day like robots. The woman is usually multitasking with a cell phone attached to her ear as she's making dinner and yelling at the kids to quiet down while the man is drinking a beer and watching the game with a friend. This is just an analogy but you get the point. By the time the evening is over, they haven't spent one second of quality time together all day long. This goes on month after month, year after year and then they can't figure out how their marriage failed! Although nights like that are expected, there also needs to be a balance. The typical "ho hum" attitude doesn't work for me and it just isn't in my DNA. I'm a passionate person who likes to go out and do things that are fun with the lady I'm sharing my life with and I also need to feel a strong connection there as well. The whole purpose for me is to have a best friend, a partner and a companion who I'm deeply in love with, not just a roommate. To achieve this, you have to be creative at times in order to keep the fire going in your relationship or the flame will die out. Nothing runs on automatic pilot.

#4. AFFECTION - I tried to be in a relationship before where the woman was non-affectionate and that doesn't work for me. Human touch is a beautiful thing and it can be a lonely world without it. I love to hug, kiss, cuddle and feel close to the person I'm with. I'm not talking about smothering your partner or attaching yourself to them like glue because everyone needs their personal space, but it's nice to come home to someone who will wrap their arms around you when you've had a long, exhausting day!

#5. TEAMWORK - I don't believe in gender roles. Just because I'm a man doesn't mean I can't shop or that my woman can't mow the lawn. I have never agreed with that old fashioned philosophy. I think the responsibilities should be divvied up according to who's better at what. That's how your household will run smoother and more efficiently. Then, whatever is left over is either done together or you take turns. Teamwork is about defending each other as well. This means when someone is talking shit behind my back, you speak out on my behalf since I'm not there to protect myself. Some women will just sit there and let the person carry on without ever saying a word or they'll even join in! That's not right and you'll never have to worry about that on my end because I don't tolerate people saying negative things about my woman. Especially to my face. Teamwork also applies to finances. You both contribute to the bills but you also carry each other through tough times. In other words... If I lose my job, you'll step up and support the household until I can find something else (without giving me a hard time about it) just like I would do for you. It's bad enough to be unemployed. The last thing you need is your significant other making it worse for you. Relationships are a partnership and there are enough people in the world that don't care about you so the least you can do is care for each other. I've been with women in the past who moved in with me and didn't pay a thing for months which no one had a problem with but the rare times when I needed to lean on my lady, I got treated like shit and reminded every day of how she's not going to support her man. To sum it up, selfish women like that have no place in my life. 

Well, that's my 1-5 list. Please don't "cherry pick" through it and disregard the things you don't like! If you feel that you have to do that, then we are not a match. This is about finding the person I'm spending the rest of my life with so it's very important that we're on the same page with ALL of those points. If you feel that we are, then I would like to hear your thoughts on each one of them. Please include that with your response in as much detail as you can. I realize that the list doesn't cover everything because how you live, what your personal goals are, habits, pet peeves, etc. are important to know as well but I think it's a great start! 

My views on marriage and divorce...

Most of us have made mistakes in the past so I'm not here to judge you for yours nor do I want you to judge me for mine. However, my thoughts for the future is to never get a divorce. I don't even want that to be an option. As long as there is no cheating or physical abuse going on, I think everything else can be worked out. There are stages to go through before getting a divorce should even be considered. If you can't talk out your differences one on one, then you should go and get marital counseling. If that doesn't work, then either try another therapist or call for a separation to let things calm down. In the meantime, you both look to find solutions that can bring you back together again. This is how it should be. People get married now a days with the thought in mind that they can always get a divorce if it doesn't work out. That's flat out bullshit (excuse my French) and it defeats the purpose of getting married in the first place. You might as well just be in a relationship if you're going to think along those lines. Marriage is a lifelong commitment and I want someone who's going to take it as seriously as I am.

My two preferences are that you're between the ages of 21-36 and on the average to thin side. Don't get me wrong, your physical make up won't be near as important as your intangibles are and to make my point... have you ever been with someone you could pass by a dozen times in a grocery store and never notice them but the more you got to know that person, the more attractive they became? That's what counts more than anything because it can work the other way too. There are members of the opposite sex that are so attractive you can trip over yourself looking at them but as soon as they open their mouth, it all goes downhill a hurry! So I'm really not as superficial as it might sound like. I just have preferences like everyone else. 

As for me...

Don't expect a male model here with the body of a professional athlete. I consider myself an average looking guy but I do take pride in having above average qualities. You can find more attractive men on Craigslist or anywhere else in the world for that matter but the type of relationship I'm offering along with how you'll be treated is like finding a needle in a haystack! This is where I separate myself from the crowd. 

My stats are... 

I'm 38 years old, 6ft tall, stocky, broad shoulders and big arms (but no 6-pack abs or tats and not your typical Oregonian guy, sorry), dark brown hair, medium brown eyes and I have a mustache with a goatee. I'm willing to send you my photos upon seeing yours. If we're attracted to each other and we agree on my 1-5 list as well, I would LOVE to get to know you and see if we can make something out of this! I might not live in your area at the current time but if we're meant to be, we''ll find a way to make it work.

Finally, I have many personal interests but it would take me all day to list every one of them so I'll just give you my top 10 not necessarily in order! Let me know what we have in common here as well...

#1. Camping & fishing

title: Uncertainty: hard-to-stomach fact #17

Well, one would think that after 40-some years of facing the same reality, that one would eventually become accustomed to certain unassailable facts about it.

So why, then, is it so surprising, so raw, and so new, every time?

I speak, of course, of having a broken heart...

And what's the deal with yearning for someone long after they've made it clear that they want
nothing whatsoever to do with you?

What was it that Pascal said.... hmm... I think it was something to this effect:

"Love has its own reasons, of which reason itself is entirely unaware."

Anyhow, I'm clearly a good candidate for another broken heart. I seem to enjoy them.

(...& this may seem glib or sarcastic, but I think there must be a kernel of truth in it. After all, nothing makes one feel quite so alive as a broken heart.)

So please, get in touch! I seem to be in need of a new woman in my life.

-Max

"When your bow is broken
and your last arrow spent---
shoot! Shoot with all your heart."

title: Be bold, go old(er)
text:
Has there always been something about older men you find intriguing? A curiosity? Or perhaps you've dabbled before in a relationship where there was a disparity in age and for you this is now a preference and you are coming back for more.

Unquestionably, older men are different from younger men who often lack maturity and certainly that confidence born from wisdom. No pretentiousness. No false bravado and silly games. You find yourself comfortably slipping into conversation with older men who show interest in you and actually (gasp) have something worthwhile to say.

You're also a rule breaker--or dream of being one who does. You admit that it would be a rush to date someone who isn't typically the norm for a woman your age. Being on his arm out in public and enjoying dates while out in public would be deliciously trippy as other's look on and discreetly stare.

It would be refreshing to let down your guard and just luxuriate in the now. To be uncensored. Carefree. And be with a man who will take a nurturing lead. One of those attractions you have towards older men is that the right one would be not just your partner and lover but also your mentor and your teacher.

Sexually, you know you'd soar. The naughtiness of breaking rules collides sexily with all of the attention and patience an older man would show you. Men of experience excite you...in that they are not rushed. Nor are they selfish. You'd love for a man to take his time and open you up--allowing you to taste and feel the full gamut of your sexuality without reservation.

Is this woman you? I want to emphasize that this isn't a Casual Encounter but a true M4W placement. This isn't some silly little fantasy one-off but instead intended to lead to a more long-term relationship. If she might be you, I do hope you write. I am professional, handsome and looking for a sexy and adventurous woman who relates to these words. Find each other? Then the approaching spring will have suddenly become very warm and exciting.

title: Make an ad yourself, coward...
text:
"Coward" - A word not normally associated with women. In fact, it's a word generally specifically associated with men. Because women can't be "cowards" - It's just accepted and assumed you'll be irrationally afraid (or rationally afraid, since men can be called "coward" when there's clear danger to their lives to shame them into doing stupid shit, aint that right ladies?).

But, the fact that the average age of the people that make ads for the Women Seeking Men section is around 40 brings about two interesting points:

I won't say that's a particularly bad tactic, especially since you'd be a cold, unfeeling bitch if you posted, and leave 90% of those who responded without a reply of your own - Buuuhhhttt, you might see where it might be frustrating to some, 'cuz we don't have 5,000 ads to look through over there, like you do here (or you might not see that, 'cuz you don't need to be concerned with trivial things like that in order to get laid).

Second, you may have already posted on there and had your post flagged for removal (not too unlike what you'll likely do with this due to your spite and belief that if you can get something deleted, it was never true to begin with and/or doesn't matter, so you can proceed with your facade that you're a halfway decent person, in that delusional mind of yours). The majority of men that are participating are manipulative pieces of shit, and you don't deserve anything better (in fact, you demand that, but that's a whole 'nother explanation for a whole 'nother time). There are exceptions, of that I have no doubt, but it's goddamn hard to find them, 'cuz guys that come across them hold onto them tight, and a majority of you are so goddamn delusional, you can convince yourselves you're one of those "exceptions", despite showing every trait of the average dumb bitch, so it's not like we can say we're looking for an exception to the rule and actually find it ('cuz there's enough of you liars that it'd drowned out any of you that were truthfully exceptions).

title: Uncertainty: hard-to-stomach fact #17
text:
Well, one would think that after 40-some years of facing the same reality, that one would eventually become accustomed to certain unassailable facts about it.

So why, then, is it so surprising, so raw, and so new, every time?

I speak, of course, of having a broken heart...

And what's the deal with yearning for someone long after they've made it clear that they want
nothing whatsoever to do with you?

What was it that Pascal said.... hmm... I think it was something to this effect:

"Love has its own reasons, of which reason itself is entirely unaware."

Anyhow, I'm clearly a good candidate for another broken heart. I seem to enjoy them.

(...& this may seem glib or sarcastic, but I think there must be a kernel of truth in it. After all, nothing makes one feel quite so alive as a broken heart.)

So please, get in touch! I seem to be in need of a new woman in my life.

-Max

"When your bow is broken
and your last arrow spent---
shoot! Shoot with all your heart."

-Anonymous

p.s. I will show you a pic of myself after we've begun communicating.

title: Home is
text:
Every day I trudge through the frozen tundra hoping it will be the day you walk into my life. Each day I let my hope trickle back, untarnished.

You, like a cabin in the snow windows glow orange from the fire dancing in the fireplace. Your warmth just waiting to be appreciated.

I know I have known you before. Somewhere, somehow, we loved and it left an imprint on my soul that I have felt my entire life.

In my hometown I speak of the galaxies that swirl in my soul, and what it would mean to have my soul's mate lay her head on my chest as she fell asleep. The women here ask how big my cock is and if I can find them pills. This has been a huge setback in my pursuit of purity.

I'm sure I wouldn't know what you look like now, or how old you'be grown while waiting, or even where this life has taken you, so those things don't matter. I know that I'll know, in the same unexplainable way that I know how to grow my hair and beat my heart, something in me will know that it's you, and you'll know how to show me.

I will be the first to admit that there is a certain desperation in bringing my search here. Has it really come to this? Yes, but this despiration isn't for any one. It's for the only one. 

I suppose, more than anything I just want to know that you're safe; that you haven't given up and settled for someone who wouldn't love you the way you deserve.

If you seeing these words happens to be the only contact we have this life, know that rarely does a night go by when I don't stare at the stars and think of you.

title: One Fun Friend
text:
body : hwp height : 5'8" (172cm) status : single

age: 54

Maybe you and I are both looking for that best friend and lover. No drama here, just a regular guy looking for her.
I have been here 3 years now. I work regular M-F 8-5 hours. I moved here from about an hour away after a divorce. I bought a little 1940s built house and have enjoyed my independence and new found quiet time in fixing it up and making it my own. I enjoy putzing around the house and yard.
But now I am missing that connection with a woman and really ready to start finding her. Get out of the house sometimes, have fun, have conversations, the playful banter and see where it leads. At this stage of life the dating sites seem too much like having a part time job. An interview process ! Haha. 
I am happy, healthy, exercise, and just enjoy each day as I can. And the quality nap on a weekend haha. I am 54, 5'8", slimmer build. Professional. Neat and clean cut.
Not complicated, no drama. We both have our busy lives, are content and self sufficient, but are missing that connection. After a divorce, your mutual friends go by the wayside, and the distance for the guy friends just seems to keep us from getting together. And your work friends are just that, you need to keep yourself guarded a bit. So I am really ready to just have that one person nearby that you can call or text and say "hey, what are you doing? . . . Do you want to ....?"

So I just wanted to assure you that I am just a normal guy looking to start something with a sensual woman. So this is not too complicated for me, I am really ready. Ready for that friend. And I wanted to just say if you are not interested, I am not some weirdo that would continue to bug you or try to contact you. I'm too busy for that and would just move on looking for that friend. Just say so that I could know that.

I guess I am looking for two things in my life, they could be mutually exclusive, but it would be awesome if they were encompassed in the same woman. The one side is a female friend to hang with and see where it leads. Get out on regular dates for whatever we feel up to. A nice dinner or the dive bar for a burger and a beer. Good conversation, someone to share the "what's going on in your life these days?". Share the stories, outside of our politically correct workday daily lives. Or the art fair, a movie in or out, ballgame, the bookstore, people watching, whatever. The little road trips. For a guy, hanging around with a woman can be so much more interesting, especially at this stage of life.

On the other side I want to meet a sensual woman. I know what you are thinking, but no I am not that guy! A woman that doesn't just "like" sex, she "loves" sex. It is a part of her being more like a need than a want. She can be a little naughty. Like a little note or text that says "I want to see you, when are you free?" She wants the "God, I really needed that", sometimes. The next day she has a little smile through her day and feels good about her new found friend and how he makes her feel.
So there, I got it all out. Not perfect and not looking for perfect. Just the one.

title: Message on the wind
text:
I'd like to meet a person for a long-term partnership. Why craigslist? Well, I'm a pretty decent if eccentric person. Why couldn't I cross paths with a compatible decent and eccentric person?

I'm a busy graduate student, but have enough room in life for companionship with a flexible, independent partner. I value personal happiness over social status, and aspire towards values rather than wealth. In that, having a social consciousness is important to me and in a partner. I'm a strong LGBT advocate. Spirituality is becoming more important to me as I get older, and I'd also appreciate some form of that in a partner. I'm personally drawn to Buddhist philosophies. I ado my best to stay true to my own nature while being concerned for this planet and wanting to leave this place at least a little bit better than how I found it. I'm a realist with perhaps a little romanticism up my sleeve.

Other than that, I'm a good listener, opinionated but always evolving, a realist with some tasteful metaphysical leanings, strongly DIY but am capable of asking for help, melancholy but not morbid, fascinated by both life and death, curious and self aware, very honest with some secrets. I'm a little nerdy, and a little bit of a naturalist who enjoys camping and time in nature. I love 60s music, and 90s alternative/indie rock, and try to make it out to shows at least one in awhile. 

Someday I'd like to live on a small hobby farm, perhaps raising vegetables, chickens, and having a bee hive, but may settle for a quiet part of town with a big yard and brewing some beer in the basement. I look a little bit like Dracula crossed with Johnny Depp's Gilbert Grape. Average height, brown eyes. 

We'd probably get along if you find this funny:

"To be is to do" -- Socrates

title: Sincerely Looking
text:
Hi,

I'm a single dad, looking for a single lady, to share in life's journey. I am missing a confidant in my life, and desire a monogamous, long-term relationship.

My kids, (17 & 13), are with me 50% of the time, and I'm free every-other weekend, Tuesday nights, and sometimes Thursdays, for possible dates. My availability would increase, after we both got to a point where we are comfortable meeting the kids. 

Ideally, I'm looking for someone with whom I share a passionate attraction, and a genuine fondness for being together. I believe expressing one's feelings, and communication are important in a relationship. 

Attraction; physical attraction is an important aspect of a relationship, but personality is even more-so.

What do I find attractive? 

As far as physical features, I'm attracted to thin, slender, athletic, or average body types. I prefer black, dark brown, or light brown hair. I prefer that you be shorter than me, but equal, to a little taller is fine. 
Obviously, exceptions can always be made to any, or all of these traits. I just thought I would be up front with what catches my eye, and grabs my interest.

Personality-wise; a playful, witty sense of humor is desirable. Being considerate, thoughtful, and having a positive outlook are ideal. 

Lifestyle; non-smoker, non to social drinker are preferred.

My passions are food, and music. I can expound on these if you decide to contact me. 

If you decide to respond, please have a pic, and put your favorite fruit in the subject line, to weed out spam.

Thanks for reading!

title: Bass-ackwards Sexual Relationship
text:
Sexual desire, passion and playfulness are extremely important in lasting relationships. This is especially true if your sexual flavors are more robuts than pure vanilla. If you don't fully agree with these statements, please move on to the next posting. The problem is, when you date and meet in conventional ways it can be very difficult to have open, honest and direct discussions about something so important. It's bass-akwards. Everyone is on their best behavior and that means tippy-toeing and dancing around telling a partner what you'd like to share and do with (and to) them. We fear frightening them off or giving off the wrong impression.

We want there to be a relationship that transcends "just sex" so we err on the side of being cautious. Too much time passes. Routines and impressions are formed. That spark of naughtiness that both secretly wanted fizzles out or never fully materializes. No one had the nerve to say, "I love being tied up" or "I've been naughty, spank my ass."

Other dating rituals? They still exist. Dinners. Movies. Events. Hanging out. Just now, they can also take on a sexier edge. You're in this with a partner for the long haul...and your sexual life is in vivid color as a terrific bonus.

You can't strike up that conversation on eHarmony or Match. You meet someone from there, you revert to the cautious, conservative self. You don't want the fleeting one-off of Casual Encounters, either. You're not fucking for sport...you just want one man who will ring your chimes in many different ways. You want to celebrate and accentuate your sexuality and femininity. It's nothing that should need to be suppressed or hidden away.

Lets try to find each other here. I'm accomplished, handsome, polite and centered (not self-centered). Medium height. Medium build. Large sexual appetite. Gi-normous when it comes to attentiveness, creativity and being well-mannered.

You are younger by a few years or more. You have a naughty side you just can't hide or are damn sick and tired of trying. You've taken care of your mind and body and want something more than what you are finding.

Please write to me if you want something that will be on-going, exlusive, meaningful and deep. Don't hide your kinks. Spill them.

title: A companion please
text:
I am here looking for a companion. I would really like to find someone in real life but all places have failed and I certainly do not pick up women at the bars. I have hoped to find someone at church, the gym, art classes, etc. All with no real luck.

So here I am on Craigslist of all places. You know, the place where you can find that pee'd on couch, a . . . ehhhhm . . . modeling job, a beat up 1992 toyota corolla for $30000, enough "shabby-chic" stuff to fill the state of Idaho, and bazillion other things. Why not try and find someone to love on?

I am not very normal. I have tried to act normal and do a very good job at it, and it isn't some weird personality disorder. I have a degree in Geophysics, with honors. I own a good business. I have done the Boston Marathon and the Ironman World Championship. I am a successful artist. I am not saying those things to brag, but it has been more of bane really. I don't know what it is but all that stuff seems to scare people away. I just consider it a lifetime of fun. I always thought it was normal to have done all those things, but after talking with people over the years, I realized it isn't. I am sure someone will write to me and call me an asshole for talking about it.

These days my life is a little more low key. I like to sing, and play with my dogs. Take long drives in the country or weekend road trips. Take yoga classes. Watch movies (watching movies alone in a theater is kind of drag). I want to go to Kauai this year, and Sedona. I still go to the gym on a regular basis, mainly to do cardio and some pretty basic core work and lifting. I read scientific papers. I don't really read books, unless they are filled with useful info. I tried to read Huxley's Island and got half way through and got bored. I was reading a book on Critical Thinking and I was enjoying that. I have read the Bible twice, one an in depth study. It is a fascinating book. I don't talk about it much though because I don't like people forcing their views on me, so I try to be sensitive about that with other's, so yes, I am a Christian as well. A Christian, scientist, athlete, artist. 

So, here I am looking for a companion. I don't want anything heavy or intense to start off. I would love to find my life partner/wife, but I am going to temper my hopes for now. I have been single for 3 1/2 years and I am lonely. I will admit it. I would like to go out for dinners, cook together, watch movies together, maybe go on a road trip, take art classes, sing karaoke (it is OK if you don't sing), etc. There are a bazillion thing we could do together and I would expect you to bring something new and interesting to the table, not in a demanding way, but in a "you are an awesome human with beautiful experiences to share" kind of way.

You are going to have to like dogs. That is important. My girls bring such immense peace I could never imagine being without a couple of dogs in my life. If you have dogs? Even better. More to love.

I also like to hold hands when in public. That is pretty important to me, and the occasional kiss in public is important too.

So, the basics are that I am 47, in pretty good shape at 5'10. I have dirty blonde hair with blue eyes. I have a high hairline but not because I am losing my hair, but because it is always been that way. I went on a date they other night and the woman was really nasty about it. I don't know why she went out with me because all my pictures are quite accurate. 

So, that about sums it up. If you write it would be great if you said more than a few words. Maybe tell me about a dream that came true, or something you look forward to have happening, or about an experience that changed your life. Sending a picture ALWAYS helps and I promise anyone who sends a picture with their first reply will get mine, even if I am not interested. 

Oh, I was married before. That ended in 1996. And as far as age goes, that is completely open. I have had wonderful connections with women as young as 30 and as old as 54. Age does not matter to me. At all.

title: "I was afraid I'd eat your brains,"
text:
"'... 'Cause I'm evil." --The National, "Conversation 16"

I like to use song lyrics or titles as my posting title on the rare and misguided occasions that I make a posting here. I suppose it's meant to be a sort of code for people that listen to the same kind of music that I do. It's not really a prerequisite, but it's definitely a bonus.

I suppose this is the part where I'm supposed to demonstrate that I am a somehow better or at least above average person. But, I don't really subscribe to the standard model of comparison. Mostly because I would fail with most metrics that a lady would espouse to value.

Own place? Recently lost my apartment. Car? Finally gave up the ghost after becoming too expensive to maintain. Job? Been on benefits for quite awhile and still trying to find a healthy environment.

So you might see why I might not be especially hopeful, even with the great equalizer that is online dating.

But I don't really like going to bars. Can make your own cocktails for much less anyway. I prefer concerts, movies, and outdoor activities. Not that those are good ways to meet people, though they could be a shared interest.

I don't really like to drink either. I prefer cannabis, so I'm friendly to that particular vice. Cigarettes maybe, but I quit a couple of years ago. It seems pretty expensive and stinky to me now.

This probably sounds a bit pessimistic for a personals ad. But, I am actually more of an optimist usually and do have some positive qualities that I can admit to:

Mastery of the English language, genius-level IQ, discerning taste in film and music, and being a quintessentially, sickeningly, and stereotypically nice guy.

I thought of putting Caucasian, as a joke. But I think it's too soon for that.

I am looking for a woman between the ages of, say, 21 and 32. Someone kind, caring, intelligent, and genuine. I'd be more interested in a liberal and free-thinking type--someone else who's a feminist too.

I suppose that I am technically spiritually agnostic, though I have occasionally attended a UU church, but anything that's too dogmatic frightens me. They just had good music, vibes, people, and eggrolls.

I would like someone that is relatively fit and healthy--someone that makes some concerted effort to take care of themselves. I could stand to gain a few pounds myself, but fall between athletic and thin, maybe.

Lastly, I do not discriminate based on pathologies. Glass houses, you know?

Looking for something to chat with over IM or text for a non-interminable period of time to get to know someone before meeting.

In the interest of plausible deniability, I can only offer a photograph for a photograph.

I look forward to hearing from someone interesting.

'Til all are one.

P.S. Oh yeah, I'm a real person. The weather in the Cities is absolutely lovely today -- sunny and almost 70 degrees!

title: When you can't run, you crawl. And when you can't do that...
text:
Always feels weird trying to show off only the best parts of myself in the hopes of impressing an intangible future girlfriend. So far, a traditional posting hasn't done me much good, so let's try the direct approach. I'll try my best to be genuine, and talk about all the things I'm supposed to keep to myself.

I'm a geek through and through. Seems like a trivial way to start things off, but you have to understand how much it's a part of who I am. When I was a kid, I used to cry when I missed an episode of a favorite TV show. Back then I had a soft spot for family sitcoms because the characters had all the things I didn't. I remember watching these fictional people love and care for each other and vowing that someday I would have that. To this day it still gets to me when I see a scene with a crying child getting comforted by a parent. I can't count how many times as a kid I've cried for someone to come and save me like that--to hold me, and tell me everything was going to be okay.

Strangely enough, it was books and videogames and TV shows that kept me going. Zelda taught me to be brave, even when I was scared and alone. The Matrix taught me to see beyond my own world. Harry Potter taught me more about love and hope and kindness than my family, my school, or my church ever did.

For the first two decades of my life I was unhappy. I was so desperate and idealistic as I was finishing high school that I left for Marine Corps boot camp on the night of my graduation. Fortunately I was a reservist and never got deployed. I never belonged in the military and knew that even before joining. I just needed to prove myself, if only to myself. To know what I was capable of. At the very least I got over my extreme shyness and discovered my own confidence.

It was only when I left home for college that my life truly began. Slowly, I began to heal. Slowly, I made friends--people who would eventually become my true family. This took longer than I care to admit since the scars I have tend to linger and get in the way. I discovered love--genuine, life-affirming, absolute love for everything on this little planet--on August 31, 2010, on a Tuesday night. It's a long story, and I'll always tell it to anyone who asks. For now I'll just say it concerns losing a dear friend, being trapped for a month in Mozambique, Africa, getting suspended from school, and getting myself lost and then found in the Nevada desert.

I have a unique perspective about love. There's that saying that "The loneliest people are the kindest. The saddest people smile the brightest. The most damaged people are the wisest. . ." Well, love was absent for the first two decades of my life, and when I finally experienced it, when I finally felt something where nothing used to be, it made all the difference. Regardless of how shitty life may be, of how sad and lonely I may feel, I will always love. 

But just because I'm kind of a hippie doesn't mean that I'm happy with my life. Like many, I am constantly bent over the table by student loans. In Seattle that was the only problem in my life, but it screwed over everything else. When I decided to move to Minnesota in January 2015, it was in the hopes of getting some relief from my money problems before moving back West. But this has turned out to be one of the biggest mistakes of my life, up there with joining the military. It's not the place itself, but that it was all set up by my parents, who lied and said all the things I needed to hear for me to agree to move. Regardless of how shitty they were as parents, they were still my parents. And I wanted to do this one good thing for them. And maybe--just maybe--it would be a first step toward something better for everyone involved. To make another long story short, the mistake was to think I could trust my parents.

In the end, I was stuck in a cold unfamiliar place, with no friends and no job, and a lot of old family scars reopened. I gave up everything I had worked so long for, for this? It's hard enough starting over someplace new, but to do it while utterly depressed is just overwhelming. At least I have a job that pays well at the moment. It's been slow-going meeting new people. I've a number of acquaintances, and even a friend or two, but no one who has the time for me. Even though in person I can be as social as anyone, the hard part is just getting out the door, or finding the motivation to call someone back. 

I've had one lonely year so far here in Minnesota. I'll probably move before this year is up. My one wish when I leave is to have someone truly miss me when I go. 

If you made it this far, thanks for reading. If I sound like someone you'd like to get to know then why not give me a chance? If you like geeky things like anime, gaming, and binge-watching netflix, or if you recognized the quote from the posting title, we'll probably get along. Since I've already posted my pics, I'd like yours. Have a quote in your title too so I know you're genuine.

Here we go :) 

First of all these are my preferences and although I tend to stick by them more often than not there are always exceptions. I tend not to be attracted to plus size women. I probably just offended half the people who read these. I eat fairly healthy and workout to stay in shape. I have seen curvier women who I'd consider attractive but... You know if you're one of them but they're few and far between so you're probably not. 

I don't usually go for red hair either. Like I said there's always exceptions. If you get to the end of this and say "This guy sounds like someone I might be interested in" and you meet all the other criteria... I'd hate to miss meeting my dream girl over hair color but it's not often I find myself attracted to redheads. That one you shouldn't get offended over. A lot of guys go crazy for red hair, hell a lot of my friends go crazy for red hair. Not me though and if your argument is redheads have higher sex drives save it. I couldn't care less about the sex drive of a woman I've never met and I'm looking for a lot more than that. 

Tattoos are usually a deal breaker for me. Some of them don't bother me but when I look at it I think; Is that something I want to look at for the rest of my life? like I said some are ok, but if you have frogs and lily pads tattooed all the way around your midsection I'll pass. 

I'll put intelligence and personality ahead looks any day but this is essentially a want ad so I might as well go for broke. 

I consider myself to be of above average intelligence so I look for the same in a girl. I didn't say you need to have a masters degree as I don't think that defines one's intelligence, knowledge maybe, but not over all intelligence. I've met waitresses who were brighter than some lawyers so... 

Personality is a big thing too. I'm an optimist and tend to be pretty upbeat most of the time. I don't want someone who's a drag or can't find the good even in bad situations. No matter how bad things are they can always get worse and usually do if you want them to. 

I won't date a girl who isn't well mannered and polite. If you rarely say please and thank-you you're not my type. I'm old-fashioned in a lot of ways, i.e. holding doors, taking your coat and hanging it up and just being a gentleman in general. 

Hygiene is something that I take very serious, you should too. I shower twice a day unless I skip a workout. I brush my teeth 3x a day and have a mouth full of cavity free teeth to show for it. I wear cologne and... What I'm trying to say is that my hygiene is second to none. 

My girl has to smell good so smokers are out. Casual or social drinkers are ok. I like to go out and have a cocktail or two but I don't want to date an alcoholic. 

I have a car and don't live at home... Of course I live at home. Where else would I live? Home hasn't been my parents house for more than a dozen years. I have a great job and a great social life. 

I have a pic but I'm not posting it here. I've given so many people crap for online dating that I feel like a hypocrite just writing this. I have gone on a few dates with girls I've met online but the majority of women I date I meet in person. I'm very confident, maybe on the verge of cocky but I try to keep in check. 

I was married for 7 yrs and have been divorced for 3. In those three years I've probably dated more women than guys who have been single all their lives. That might be why I know what I do and do not want in a girl. I'm looking for a girl I want to be in a long term relationship with. I like being single too so I'm taking my time to find a gal that knocks my socks off. I'm in no hurry and that's why I'm so picky. 

Just a list of other potential deal breakers- 

-Unless you're six feet tall I don't date girls with feet bigger than a size 9. I don't have a foot fetish and I'm not going to worship your footsies, just one of those things. 

-I don't date girls who never wear underwear. 

There's more but I think I've alienated enough people already. Please don't respond with three sentences especially if one asks for a pic and you didn't send one. I have no problem trading pics but if your reply says "nice ad, got a pic" it's getting deleted. Actually put your favorite color in the subject line so I know you read the whole thing. 

I know it's long but I'd rather get one genuine reply than a hundred who have no chance. 










.

title: Sick of Swiping

Dear miss/ma'am-

I'm writing to inform you that I'm going old school. In this age of swipe left or right I'm making a bold choice to move the format to something more traditional, more genuine. title: What if you're an imperfect person?
text:
When I read what others have written in this space, it makes me wonder if anyone values individuality. Everyone paints themselves as passionate and dedicated, yet totally laid back. Most people can't be all things, so you lose credibility by claiming the impossible. I've always wondered why everyone fears to be more candid. We all have various issues. Do people think they'll be able to successfully hide their blemishes forever? Why not present yourself accurately and take the pressure off of having to maintain a perpetual facade?

I consider myself to be a fairly desirable fellow in some respects, but I also understand there are things that would turn many women off. It's okay though because I'm not looking to attract all women; one really nifty gal is all it takes! Problem number one is that I'm poor. For whatever reasons, I don't have money so that takes most dating prospects out of the picture, which I accept. I've also never seen myself as a parent. Not feeling sure that I could be a proper father, I've chosen not to have kids. That's weird to some, but to me it seems like a reasonable decision.

Sometimes I get very uncomfortable in public and become quiet. Making chit-chat with strangers is torture. Crowded restaurants are very unnerving and not where I'd go for a good time. What it says about me I'm not sure, but generally if everyone tends to go en masse to anywhere, I'll hate it there. Having the place to myself (or ourselves) is when I'm most at ease and fun. 

In comfortable settings, I love to have long rhetorical debates on inconsequential topics. I'm handy and can perform most home-improvement tasks. My clothes end up filthy on a surprisingly high percentage of days. My music collection is impeccable because I've devoted a huge amount of time to that over the years. My political views are largely libertarian and I constantly urge people to consider things from an opposing perspective. I rely on my own observations, not popular belief.

So perhaps I'm not an ideal mate for most. I've looked at the lives of "normal" people and truly don't see the appeal. Even my best friends who've done everything by the book don't seem any better off. In fact they look stressed-out beyond belief. That's not the life I want. For me, having a girl pal to laugh and wrestle with sometimes would be terrific. The goal for me is to meet an interesting person, hopefully learn some things from her, and be glad we know each other without obsessing over our compliance to social norms.

If you'd like to vent about your quirks or share a short story with me, please do. If there's going to be any romantic intent with it, know that I'm a not bad-looking dude and will hoping to break even in that respect. If you're only writing to tell me to grow up, at least spell check it before sending.

title: "It is our CHOICES that show us what we truly are...
text:
...far more than our abilities."
*THIS POST IS MEANT TO INSPIRE AND PROMOTE CRITICAL THINKING*



Thought:

To think. Craigslist and the whole online concept in general...and who it attracts. How people go online expecting a relationship (something in general) from those they have yet to meet (and spend time with in person)....darn those wants and expectations. 
Perhaps they are the same people who treat relationships like "cell phones". Never being dedicated nor appreciative for what is because all the while, they're waiting for the next best thing to come around. Meantime, they drop 'm (mistreat) yet RAGE at the "phone" or blame "service" because it does not work? Unless you have Metro, that is a sign of some SERIOUS issues and lack of responsibility/reality.



Then you have the ones who "only got on here to laugh at articles" (so they say). Let's just buy into that stupid excuse. You mean to say that your life is so grand, so great...you are taking the time to "laugh at the others" who are doing something most are not willing due to fear of judgment? Which is what: Put yourself out there in an effort to find something??? (whatever that may be)

..........seriously, why make a simple thing so complicated....

You are here for a reason. So unless someone forced you against your will (for some psycho reason), don't play yourself. KEEP IT REAL! For it will help you find some depth/meaning with what you seek.



Now, don't get me wrong. Some of these craigslist postings are hilarious but those are people purposely crying for attention...in a unique way...very unique. But hey, I don't knock them for trying quite honestly. It isn't easy putting yourself out there even when you may not know what you are doing or ever been forced to look at yourself.

No one hands you a book with "How to put yourself out there on Craigslist" and even if someone did? Who is to say it would fit you perfectly? There is so much to every one of us...so I'd like to believe...so how else will you know unless you try?


I would like to believe there are some who take it seriously and genuinely trying to find something from nothing which is not an easy task. Most start online because the judgment and rejection is not something everyone can take nor handle...especially when it is in your face. Direction can be questionable with some being too critical, impatient, inexperienced and some being too careless. So many possibilities... Is the direction/meaning in hopes of some kind of happiness? Maybe. For some it can be pure boredom (attention of some sort), unfortunately.


We all have different views though, so...what is "happiness"? Do we all share the same definition? Have we ever had a taste of it and if so, was it real or was it a compromise?


Well, we haven't a clue of happiness if we've never been sad or down. And hey, we have our reasons for reading these things...and I'm sure they are along those lines. If not, we would be busy living life and doing our own thing far away from this chaos, right? But I'll tell you this, there many people out there who have never thought to think this way due to denial/fear of reality. So don't fool yourself thinking because they've never bothered that they are perfect. HAHA! ...no one is.


"Ignorance is bliss."


Most people seem to be distracted from what really matters. With television, internet and bad family/parenting (lack of guidance/positivity), things have just lost their meaning with time leaving lost people to make their own - forcing the blind to lead the blind.



So "Craigslister"... WHAT IN THE WORLD IS GOING ON AROUND HERE?! Eh, we can go on forever with that. But you...what do you search for... and why?


I have been on here for quite a while posting this. It is all in hopes it will encourage readers to seek some direction or....discover a kind of hope. Let's just say I'm a nice guy simply trying to help. Because to know what I do now and NOT share it? I wouldn't be who I am today if those who came across my path never shared their wisdom. We are all just people trying to figure things out; ourselves and this world around us just to find a "meaning".


Craigslist has shown me that those who like to read are the ones who are most willing to try (more often than not). But care? Understand? Comprehend? That all varies by perception and experience. That is where it is important to educate yourself and take on certain experiences that will benefit your mind/body.


Here is something else I've learned:
The majority of visitors on here are searching for the best bull sh...illusion ever. One that has been fed by advertisements, fashion, maybe even some (ignorant/immature) family/friends and the entertainment industry... PERFECTION!


All the while you're making yourself insecure at someone else's benefit, You're left confused/distracted. Chasing dreams rather than the meaning of them...and what they even mean TO you. We care about what something looks like or what SOMEONE ELSE THINKS rather than what it's made of or how it makes one FEEL.


No one is perfect (that includes you & I) and the day you realize that, you will be one step closer to finding some sort of direction toward some sort of belief. After that will come happiness. Happiness will bring love from within but you gotta understand and find it within yourself. So don't go wasting your time on "looks" or "money" because time will diminish that...and what will you have then?


Understanding, compromise and respect are essential...and they truly start with yourself.


"You can't help me, if you can't help yourself."



Call me old school but isn't that what a relationship should be all about?

Helping one another? To help stay focused, on track, happy, healthy and being there for one another in hopes of betterment during hardships while keeping the other person's interests at heart? Or maybe better put: "Relationship: Two people who accept one another's past, supports the present and encourages the future."


I come to think of a partner as being in a "partnership". Saying, "I got your back and you have mine." Something... that took a genuine mutual belief that enriched bond or connection which fueled team effort in hopes of sharing one another's world (then a home) and prosper together.

Once that was accomplished, "traditionally" (not saying it's a MUST because kids are not objects nor does it make you "a real parent", "mature", "responsible", "respectable" nor "accomplished"), they would then raise a child or two (seriously, if you have more kids than you have hands, you have problems or you are a freak) to share what they have found in life. To keep that...that "fire" alive or pass something down? Maybe that is Disney stuff.


Again, not to say you NEED to have kids to be "respectable" or "accomplished", not at all. Honestly, many are not meant to have kids and best if they don't. I really respect those who acknowledge and make that choice. I feel finding someone you can grow old with and be genuinely happy is key. And that should not have to be "justified" or proven by marriage or kids. It should be by the effort and time together with all happiness to show for it every day possible.


...goodness! Sounds like a lot of work! But as they say (don't ask who is "they"):


 "When you love what you do, you never work a day in your life." 


Love, in my opinion, is about appreciation, not possession. So if you NEED to get married or have kids to feel validated? Something is seriously wrong and really must take a look in the mirror. 


Murphy's law:  "Anything that can go wrong, will go wrong." 



Maybe I have it all wrong. But what I do know and have right from experience, is that if you want something meaningful and amazing? It takes time, trials, effort and strong communication on both parts. Dedication that should blossom into passion. And anything that is fast and easy, is more than likely not worth having because everyone would have it. And if anyone can have it, I'm not sure if it'd be THAT special or meaningful. For anything worth having never comes easy.

So many people looking for "fast & easy" love...and look at where that has gotten most people? Welcome to single parenthood...thanks, mom & dad! (...it is always best to blame some on else...kidding but if there is anything, I blame marketing)



Dating will go as they come. If it's really fast... what can you expect other than it to leave just as fast?

(or be very fragile)



I wish everyone all the best and hope this all helps with some direction in your life. Because you came on and read these pages for a reason.


Note when reading these things:

The larger the post, the more you have to go by when you meet and see how full of shit they could be.

The smaller the post, you can expect the meaning to be just as insignificant (or spam).



Besides...it is better to say too much, then never to say what you need to say. :)



Want something real? Find out what that is and keep it real.
Because we all have hope. That's what TRULY brought you to craigslist. And when two people strongly believe in the same thing, that is called potential!


Just keep your head up or a good thing could pass you by for even I am still searching for my other half...I just had to know myself a whole lot better in order to get an idea of it. Weird though, because when I think about it? I never thought...that the other half of ME...has a vagina, haha! Maybe yours has one as well...that's cool too. Sucks for straight guys but hey, BE HAPPY!!


If you love what is true, the world will come to you but remember, it starts with yourself. And to take a look at yourself and make a change for the better is not easy, let alone accepting what needs to be changed but know you attract what you put out. Not all the time but: 

 "Real will recognize real." 


So don't be a fool placing "requirements", "limits" or "expectations" on love. Because love does not have a face nor eyes. It has a heart. It feels. And true love, is very similar to life. It's not something you "find easily" or ask for, it's given to you...out of no where. But ya better believe, it will take a whole lot of hard work and dedication which sadly, not many are willing to do.


 "Not anyone can be a great person, but a great person can come from anywhere." 





Thank you for reading. Much love and best of luck to everyone.





If you truly enjoyed this and would like to show support or keep up with more of these kinds of things to come (please be patient), feel free to look me up on book with faces and tube of you under "NESTOsterone".


I recently moved to LA to share all this in the form of stand up comedy so please be patient as I take my words of wisdom to the motherland of shallow!

title: Looking for not just a great girl, but for an amazing girl!
text:
Let's start at the top!

I'm a 29 year old single white male. Never married, no kids, college-educated, happily employed with a career I love, surrounded by great friends and family. I have a car, a phone, an apartment I share with a friend, and all of that other stuff that seems to be important. I'm taller than average (6'1"), slightly bigger than average, but am extremely cuddly because of both of those things. Basically, I have my life together! I just want somebody to share it with.

I'm a big fan of all Minnesota sports teams, and try to go to as many games as I can. With a busy work schedule, this doesn't happen too often but I still like to try! I love to travel, and have done quite a bit of it over the past couple of years. Mostly for work, but I do some recreational travel as well. I'm not super active like go-to-the-gym-twice-a-week but I'll occasionally go out for a run. I like to think I live an somewhat active lifestyle, just without the gym part. That could change though. I do have a gym membership...New Years is coming and I still haven't thought of a solid resolution yet. 

I'm a passionate guy, meaning I care a lot for those who are in my life! I have friends and family who mean everything to me. In a relationship, I try to be a gentlemen and treat my girl like a princess. I love doing little things to let her know I am thinking about her whether it be holding the door open, writing cute notes every once in a while, sending her a text to let her know I am thinking about her, etc. I consider myself a giver, and I feel like I have a lot to give in a relationship. I'm excited to be able to make my girl happy! In a relationship, I feel like intimacy is really important. I'm very open about sex, although I do believe it comes at the right time. I love to cuddle, I love to kiss, and love being intimate. 

Basically, I am looking to see what's out there! Realistically, I know that I probably won't find my future wife...but you never know! Crazier things have happened. I have met a few girls on here before with not much luck, but I know there are some great girls out there. I don't want to find a sex buddy (meaning, only sex), I want to find somebody where it's more than that. I want a deep relationship, to be able to settle down...and while I know these things just don't happen overnight...that some of you might also be looking for the same type of situation. 

So! If you are interested, send me a message! I hope to hear from you :-)

title: Tantric massage/coffee/smiles
text:
Hit 'repeat.' LTR sought. So here's the deal. Normal, down to earth, smart and good looking married white male. Nothing like what is illustrated in the causal section of CL, sorry. Normal white male. 

What is tantric? Well anything you want really. Interesting concept, sort of the opposite of wham bam thank you mam. Not even a slow wham, really. More like exploring sensuality in cognitive ways and yes some tactile...but not necessary penetration. Toys are possible. More along the lines of a sensual relaxing massage with a conversation that matches. But there is a hint of high school limitations, you know, some reasonable thoughtful sound and smart boundaries. Was high school all that bad? Actually going home without pigging out but savoring a 'lighter fare' well....it really wasn't so bad was it.

Most white males of my generation (middle aged) were feed that skinny svelt girls were 'it.' I never got that at all. In fact it sort of left me mystified. Really? A girl that looks like a...boy? So what I am saying is ...and sure will help with the massage...is be 'there.' Be a woman with some substance. A little fat on your tummy, grand. Chubby thighs and legs, sweet. Plump here and there, wonderful! A little shocked by the size of your nice sized bottom? Dress size in the upper teens or ...twenties....? Lovely, lovely...yes very very lovely.

But just as some guys didn't get that fuller figured woman were so nice, it seems that some gals are afraid to see that they are so....lovely....as well. Go figure? Afraid of letting the genie out of the bottle? I think there might be something to that.

And yes, have pretty eyes and face. Be smart, even bookish. Politically? Be wary eyed at all the hoopla and tend to be on the conservative side, open minded but not empty headed. In other words I am not a zealot or fanatic, I am pragmatic and very open to being wrong and learning to do something better. I buried my ego long time ago. 

I would like to find a special friend and see about some of the things and ways of thinking and feeling described above. It's not rocket science. Or shouldn't be. 

So....there is the 'jump in the maelstrom of CL and wind up used and worried about contracting some terrible STD. Or.....watching more TV, reading and otherwise being a complete nun. Here is a middle way. Think about it. Ask me questions. Make an informed decision. It is your body. It is your time. It is your feelings. Have a good day.
