title: Looking for an Asian woman that values stability
text:
I know my strengths and weaknesses. I know who and what I am, and what I am not. If you're looking for someone with their life on track and will always be there for you, I might be your guy. I don't drink, I don't smoke, and I don't do drugs. If you're looking for someone to go partying with on Friday nights, go look somewhere else; I'm not your guy and I'm alright with that. I'm past that part in my life. I am ambitious and I like to keep moving my life and career forward. I'd prefer you have some sort of drive, goals, and ambition too. 
A little bit about me: I'm 24, 6' tall, and white. I've graduated from college and I've started building my career. I tend to be sarcastic and enjoy joking around (I know I probably sounded really serious so far, but I promise I don't take everything seriously). I tend to be a bit of a home body, but I still like to go exploring. I want someone to go on walks with, go to the museum or zoo with. I greatly value honesty, loyalty, and respect. I try to treat everyone with respect and just not be a jerk to people. I want to bring this up now, so it's not a surprise later. I go to the gym lifting weights at least 3 times a week. I devote a lot of time there. I want you be alright with that and supportive of it. I would prefer if you went also, which would make it time we could bond instead of time spent apart. No, I don't expect you to look like a super model or be as skinny as a rail. I needed the discipline in my life and wanted to stay healthy. 
What I'm looking for in a significant other: I'd like you to be ambitious and educated. I want you to want to do something with your life. I'd like you to be kind and compassionate. I'd like you to be a bit of a homebody and enjoy cuddling on the couch after a long day. I would want you to stay sober. I want you to realize that I would do anything for the right person and appreciate me for being your rock, just like how I'll appreciate you for being there for me. 
Well, if I sound like someone that interests you, send me an email with your favorite book in the subject line so I know you're a real person. Tell me a bit about yourself and what you're looking for.

text:
I don't drink, I don't smoke, and I don't do drugs. If you're looking for someone to go partying with on Friday nights, you'll have to go look somewhere else. I'm not your guy and I'm alright with that. I'm past that part in my life. I am ambitious and I like to keep moving my life and career forward. I'd prefer you have some sort of drive, goals, and ambition too.

No, I don't expect you to look like a super model or be as skinny as a rail. I needed the discipline in my life and wanted to stay healthy. 
What I'm looking for in a significant other: I'd like you to be ambitious and educated. I want you to want to do something with your life. I'd like you to be kind and compassionate. I'd like you to be a bit of a homebody and enjoy cuddling on the couch after a long day. I would want you to stay sober. 
I'll do anything for the right person, I'll do everything in my power to keep them happy. I hope you have the same type of attitude, since I'm pretty easy to please to begin with. 
Well, if I sound like someone that interests you, send me an email with your favorite book in the subject line so I know you're a real person. Tell me a bit about yourself and what you're looking for.

title: Life is Like
text:
Confidence goes a long way, and so does that spontaneous desire to embrace the unknown with open arms. An original, yet somewhat irreverent free spirit, with a stubborn honesty for life and a unique wit to match..... in search of an attractive and educated, yet spontaneous and fun loving gal, to engage in creative banter and witty repartee. I tend to be attracted to women who can hold their own in a conversation, appreciate an impassioned yet somewhat unique perspective on the world at times, and enjoy a glass of red wine without too much pretense. As always, the usual criteria of honesty, integrity and respect are just as important as anything else.

Truth is, at the end of the day, I'm well educated, professionally employed, and a tall, slender, attractive 41 year old guy, young at heart, with a beautiful young daughter, and a bit of that carefree sense of wanderlust, to boot. I'm looking to find a genuinely warm, considerate, intelligent, and attractive gal, who enjoys being outside, exploring new places, and taking in new experiences. Someone kind and compassionate, with individual likes and interests all her own. I have a variety of interests and hobbies myself, just looking to find the missing piece of the puzzle.

title: Fine ladies wanted
text:
I need a girl who can hold a conversation. I'm not looking to dissect the meaning of life, as long as I can talk to you and you can talk back we'll get along! Sounds basic, but you'd be surprised how much this skill is disappearing now that everyone is addicted to their phones like heroine.

There's this new trend nowadays where people are afraid of disagreement and any kind of strife. I don't like it. I like to be able to be able to talk, and yes, sometimes even argue with people who hold different views. That's how I learn what makes sense and what doesn't! There's no need to get butthurt and hold grudges over someone thinking you're wrong. Obviously I don't want to argue, BUT I definitely don't want to tip-toe around things we don't agree on by saying things like "Ehhhh let's just change the subject. . .". WHY? Life isn't all sunshine and rainbows. In my opinion you learn most from the people who disagree with you, not just the people who flatter you and tell you how right you are.

I want an affectionate sweet girl who loves snuggling up on the couch while we watch some netflix. If you can cook, if your kitchen is your man trap, than by all means trap me baby! I'd love to chow down on some homemade apple pie while sharing stories in between bites! After that I wanna hold you around your waist and make you feel warm and secure as I sing softly in your ear. 

I'm a practical guy and I don't like materialistic girls. I don't mind if you like money, but if you're one of those chicks that could be in a youtube gold digger prank video, I want nothing to do with you. I don't care how hot/talented in bed you are. I want your focus to be on whether or not I make you feel secure and happy, not on whether or not I can buy you a new pair of heels. 

I find shyness in a girl to be feminine and endearing. It's actually kinda nice to watch you be shy at first and then slowly blossom and come out of your shell. I wanna make you feel secure so that you share your less superficial thoughts with me. 

I'm pretty athletic as well and ALWAYS willing to try a new sport. If you got a sport you love doing and looking for someone to share it with, I'm your guy. I'm pretty active but I've never really restricted myself to one particular activity. If you got one you love doing, let's do it!

title: What We Are All Looking For
text:
Short Version: I am an educated, respectful, fun-loving and open minded professional seeking a potential LTR with a fun and responsible woman.

Slightly Longer Version:

I am well aware that this place is seen as a meat market, and that single men are seen as the least desirable commodity in the "marketplace" for all intents and purposes.

That does make it quite difficult for anyone using CL to actually make a connection. But I am going to try. . .

Looking for a female between 35-50 (wide range I know but the range I seem to work with) who's looking more than just a one night stand. Now don't get me wrong, I love sex as much as the next reasonably adjusted human being but I want something that's more than just that. The difference between just sex and making love is that spark, that connection that it is building toward something (even if you are unsure where it is heading). I want to build something real. And I would like it to last. That takes both time and communication. Emphasis on time. Not trying to sleep with someone right away, OK?

I will add that I am looking for drama free, as I have been there, done that, have a tattered old t-shirt and a couple fading marks from previous bouts of it. I know life happens but I would like to start fresh if I can. 

I'm in good shape, but not perfect. I am pretty sure that unless you are looking for a gym rat, I will pass muster (32 inch waist if that helps). For those that care, I am black and in my forties, more kid than old man in temperament and I love to try new things. I did not have a lot of opportunity to do that over the last two years and I would like to change that. The recent weather shift has made me long for the water park or the beach if that tells you anything. Like sports but do not live for them, and like to play as well as watch.

Have some nerdish pursuits but not full on (love Star Trek, Game of Thrones, and the Marvel Cinematic Universe), so you might be dragged to a movie or a binge watching of a season here or there. Went to college. Have a job, my own place and car. Can discuss current events (or not), and have read a few books in my time.

Been years since I did a pub crawl (not a big drinker, though), or tried any exotic foods at a new restaurant. More than willing to try your favorite thing to do a couple of times to see if I like it as well (but not tofu, but wiling to agree to disagree there).

As to who I am interested in, I have learned that it depends. Be open minded, willing to try things and have your own opinion. Physically, I like different types, but I am not into BBWs (sorry, just personal choice not a value judgment). Because this is CL, I want to make it clear that curvy to me ends near size 16 or thereabouts. I do not wish to waste either of our time here. Your hair color, or style, country of origin or your skin color are of no consequence here. Different works for me. 

I do not care if you have kids, just have some time to go out. Cannot get to know you if we never spend time together.

So if you are still reading at this point, email me with your favorite color in the subject line. If that is not there, I will just delete the email without opening it because spam/scam happens. Not trying to waste time here, just find someone compatible. Oh yeah, if the length of this did not convince you that I am real, yesterday was gloriously sunny and warm (was even above 70 in places) and today is overcast and closer to normal March temperatures here in the Cities but still warmer than average.

Thanks for reading. . .
hiv/hsv/hpv: Negative and keeping it that way

title: Real as real gets, try me
text:
Single parents. I am sorry but I'm not looking for a package deal. I thought I would state that early as to avoid wasting your time reading this.

I always feel sites like match and the other dating sites are a bit of a shit show. To elaborate, it's like selling yourself in one way or another. It either creates unrealistic expectations by allowing people to try and create to "perfect profile" to get dates or it completely makes us lose touch with the fact that it's another person on the other end of the conversation. It's so easy to find some reason to skip on and move to the next attractive guy/girl.

It's all about competition which makes things feel forced. People are competing, sometimes desperately not to be single. I've often found that either you fit the bill for that person and they want to jump in way too fast and go all out or you don't and they just pretend you don't exist.

If you actually go out on the dates it can be like a full time job in itself trying to narrow down people and frankly the thought of ten boring or awkward dates to realize none are a good fit is disheartening enough to just want to quit dating all together.

I enjoy being single but there are aspects I miss about having someone. 

Who am I looking for? I am not sure I know the answer specifically. I think sometimes I have unrealistic standards. Not just for a potential partner but I hold myself to a high standard and I am self critical. 

I also believe we only get one life, one chance, and despite all the unpredictable shit that life constantly throws in your face you have total control. Not control over what happens to us but simply how we perceive what happens. 

I'm not saying when you're having a bad day just pretend everything is perfect and put on your best fake smile and take it. Just that as I've gotten older I have learned to let that which doesn't matter truly slide. I look around and more often than not I'm disappointed. I truly enjoy my life and love working towards making it better. Many things about our country and society disappoint me. Our politics are insane and don't even get me started on policies and laws.

Sometimes I'm disappointed in myself. Not like I sit and pout and think I'm a failure but just in the sense that I'm always thinking I can be doing something productive. Learning something new. 

I know I'm talking a lot about myself but bear with me. 

I've never been one to have many friends. I keep a few very close friends and family members near me but I am not find of large groups or gatherings of people but hey sometimes you have to bite the bullet and I know how to behave appropriately. My parents taught me respect and manners. (One of my pet peeves is watching kids disrespect their parents...)

I'm more they type to sit quietly and listen then take the center of attention or do a lot of talking, however if you bring up a subject I'm passionate about or ask a question I'm not afraid to answer honestly and speak my mind. I'm definitely an introvert but I am constantly analyzing everyone and everything. I have a powerful imagination and can sometimes sit and do what appears to be nothing when I'm actually breaking something down in my head and I'm millions of miles away.

I love to create things. Solving problems is what I love and I love it even more when it has to do with people
I love or any of my passions. I've made a living off fishing and shooting in one way or another most of my life. It's been my passion, obsession and the one constant in my life. Being outdoors as far from people or civilization with a Bon fire and the ones that matter most, there is nothing like that in the world. 

I've traveled and moved a ton. It's been a blessing and a curse. I have met so many amazing people. I've done and seen some amazing things and yet forming a real genuine and lasting connection has always been a problem for me. My family have always been gypsies jumping from place to place and though I've moved a ton in the last decade and a half I've called Minnesota my home. I intend to stay in or part or another for a long time. 

Sure I'd love to go back to traveling but Minnesota is my home. I love the culture and the people and there is no place I'd rather live.

Now for the important part, the point of this writing. I was looking for someone, but hadn't explained in any detail whom. 

I will leave age, race, political beliefs, income or career field, and education out. Although I'd be interested to meet someone I get to know everything about and we can talk about all that I want someone that will accept me for me like anyone else wants. Don't be afraid to call me on my bullshit but be ready to accept it back with an open mind. 

If you try to control me or you are easily made jealous you will push me away very quickly. I'm not flirty and when I am committed I am committed. I don't really do bars although once in a while it's fun. 

I'd like to have some similar interests or hobbies we can do together yet at the same time you should have your own and we can do our own things without worry of drama or cheating.

As far as sex I want someone who is open to talk about it and doesn't set expectations from the get go. I like sex as much as the next guy but it doesn't do it for me unless I have an actual connection. I have to find you physically attractive yes but I find a wide variety of features attractive physically and if there is no real connection it's just boring like we are going through the motions. I also don't like to set expectations like at least three dates.if you want that, fine just don't tell me about it. I think if we have sex it should be because we both want it not because we went out three times.

Basically I'm an open book. Ask me anything and I'll answer. I will not bullshit you and I'm not trying to get laid. If you want a guy who will be honest and if there is a connection could be the best friend you've ever had send me an email and maybe we can have some interesting conversation. I've told you too much about how I think now it's your turn.

If you read all that you may as well send a message or that was a waste :)

title: Fine ladies wanted
text:
I need a girl who can hold a conversation. I'm not looking to dissect the meaning of life, as long as I can talk to you and you can talk back we'll get along! Sounds basic, but you'd be surprised how much this skill is disappearing now that everyone is addicted to their phones like heroine.

There's this new trend nowadays where people are afraid of disagreement and any kind of strife. I don't like it. I like to be able to be able to talk, and yes, sometimes even argue with people who hold different views. That's how I learn what makes sense and what doesn't! There's no need to get butthurt and hold grudges over someone thinking you're wrong. Obviously I don't want to argue, BUT I definitely don't want to tip-toe around things we don't agree on by saying things like "Ehhhh let's just change the subject. . .". WHY? Life isn't all sunshine and rainbows. In my opinion you learn most from the people who disagree with you, not just the people who flatter you and tell you how right you are.

After that I wanna hold you around your waist and make you feel warm and secure as I sing softly in your ear.

I don't mind if you like money, but if you're one of those chicks that could be in a youtube gold digger prank video, I want nothing to do with you. I don't care how hot/talented in bed you are. I want your focus to be on whether or not I make you feel secure and happy, not on whether or not I can buy you a new pair of heels. 

I find shyness in a girl to be feminine and endearing. It's actually kinda nice to watch you be shy at first and then slowly blossom and come out of your shell. I wanna make you feel secure so that you share your less superficial thoughts with me. 

I'm pretty athletic as well and ALWAYS willing to try a new sport. If you got a sport you love doing and looking for someone to share it with, I'm your guy. I'm pretty active but I've never really restricted myself to one particular activity. If you got one you love doing, let's do it!

title: Fine ladies wanted
text:
I need a girl who can hold a conversation. I'm not looking to dissect the meaning of life, as long as I can talk to you and you can talk back we'll get along! Sounds basic, but you'd be surprised how much this skill is disappearing now that everyone is addicted to their phones like heroine.

There's this new trend nowadays where people are afraid of disagreement and any kind of strife. I don't like it. I like to be able to be able to talk, and yes, sometimes even argue with people who hold different views. That's how I learn what makes sense and what doesn't! There's no need to get butthurt and hold grudges over someone thinking you're wrong. Obviously I don't want to argue, BUT I definitely don't want to tip-toe around things we don't agree on by saying things like "Ehhhh let's just change the subject. . .". WHY? Life isn't all sunshine and rainbows. In my opinion you learn most from the people who disagree with you, not just the people who flatter you and tell you how right you are.

I want an affectionate sweet girl who loves snuggling up on the couch while we watch some netflix. If you can cook, if your kitchen is your man trap, than by all means trap me baby! I'd love to chow down on some homemade apple pie while sharing stories in between bites! After that I wanna hold you around your waist and make you feel warm and secure as I sing softly in your ear. 

I'm a practical guy and I don't like materialistic girls. I don't mind if you like money, but if you're one of those chicks that could be in a youtube gold digger prank video, I want nothing to do with you. I don't care how hot/talented in bed you are. I want your focus to be on whether or not I make you feel secure and happy, not on whether or not I can buy you a new pair of heels. 

I find shyness in a girl to be feminine and endearing. It's actually kinda nice to watch you be shy at first and then slowly blossom and come out of your shell. I wanna make you feel secure so that you share your less superficial thoughts with me. 

I'm pretty athletic as well and ALWAYS willing to try a new sport. If you got a sport you love doing and looking for someone to share it with, I'm your guy. I'm pretty active but I've never really restricted myself to one particular activity. If you got one you love doing, let's do it!

title: Conscious, relationship. Just be you and I'll be me...
text:
I'm sure you wanna see a picture, "cause attraction" is a must! I agree, 100%. I also feel knowing/understanding someone for who they are makes them attractive inside which brings out a beauty the eye can see. Id like to at first capture your mind! We need a change in how relationships begin, function and come to an end if "they aren't right/healthy". I would like to talk and have a present conversation, no small talk. Not afraid to talk about "weird" stuff! 

The 4 Qualities of a Conscious Relationship

We are approaching a period of time when relationships are ready to go through a major redesign. The current paradigm isn't working. People are unsatisfied in love; people don't know how to make relationships work.

And, believe it or not, this isn't a bad thing. Because when systems break-down, that's when they change. I believe that's what's happening in the area of intimate partnership. The break-down is forcing us to move towards conscious love.

So what exactly is a conscious relationship? It's a romantic relationship that has a purpose, and that purpose is growth.

Individual growth. Growth as a couple. Growth that makes the world a better place.

As of now, most people get into relationships to satisfy their own personal needs. This might work for a few years, but eventually the relationship fails us, and we end up unsatisfied as a result.

But when two people come together with the intention of growth, the relationship strives towards something much greater than gratification. The partnership becomes a journey of evolution, and the two individuals have an opportunity to expand more than they could alone. Deep satisfaction and long-term fulfillment arise as a result.

So if you're someone who feels called to take romantic love to the next-level, below are four qualities that characterize what being a conscious couple is all about. Welcome to the path of the conscious relationship; this is next-level love.

1. The conscious couple is not attached to the outcome of the relationship -- growth comes first.

Not being attached to the outcome of the relationship does not mean you don't care what happens! It also doesn't mean that you don't have fantasies about how the relationship will turn out.

What it means is this: you're more committed to the experience of growth than you are to making the relationship "work."

The reality is, we're here to grow. Physically, mentally, emotionally and spiritually. When growth stops, we automatically feel like something's gone wrong. Because it has. Without growth, we aren't fulfilling our soul's purpose.

Unfortunately, relationships today tend to stifle growth more than enhance it. This is one of the main reasons we're failing at romantic love.

We want our partners to act in a certain way, we repress ourselves to please others, and soon enough, we feel small, oppressed and puzzled about who we've become. This, inevitably, makes the relationship feel like a cage that we want to break out of. But the unfortunate truth is: we've caged ourselves.

The conscious couple values growth more than anything else because they know this is the secret to keeping the relationship alive. Even though growth is scary (because it takes us into the unknown), the couple is willing to strive towards expansion, even at the risk of out-growing the relationship. Because of this, the relationship maintains a natural feeling of aliveness, and love between the couple does, too.

2. Each person in the relationship is committed to owning their s#*t.

Conscious couples know that we all have wounds from the past, and they understand that these wounds will be triggered in a relationship. In other words, they expect to feel abandoned, trapped, rejected, overlooked and any other shitty feeling that arises when we bond closely with another person.

Most of us still believe that relationships should only feel good, and when bad feelings surface, something has gone terribly wrong. What we fail to see in this situation is that these shitty feelings stem from our own faulty patterning! These issues are not caused by our partners; they're really caused by our internal wounds and limiting beliefs.

The conscious couple is willing to look at their past and current issues in relationships because they know that by facing these beliefs systems, they can evolve into a new relationship-reality. Dysfunctional patterns will dissolve, but only when we take responsibility for them, first.

3. All feelings are welcome; no internal process is condemned.

In a conscious relationship, there's room to feel anything. Not only that, there's room to express those feelings and fantasies to your partner. This is edgy territory. . . it's not easy to do. But it's also one of the most healing things we can experience in a partnership.

It's rare to be completely honest about who you are, and to stretch yourself to let your partner do the same. You may not like what you hear -- in fact, it may trigger the hell out of you -- but you're willing to be triggered if it means your partner can be authentic.

Like I already said, we're used to molding and changing ourselves to please people we love because we don't want them to stop loving us! This stifles the love out of our connections.

The only option is radical honesty: revealing parts of ourselves that are hard to share, and letting our partners do the same. This leads to feeling known, seen and truly understood -- a combination that will automatically enhance your love.

4. The relationship is a place to practice love.

Love, ultimately, is a practice.

A practice of acceptance, being present, forgiveness, and stretching your heart into vulnerable territories.

Sometimes we treat love like it's a destination. We want that peak feeling all the time, and when it's not there, we're not satisfied with what the relationship has become. In my mind, this is missing the whole point of love.

Love is a journey and an exploration. It's showing up for all varied nuances of your relationship and asking yourself, "What would love do here?" The answer will be different every time, and because of this, you'll get to grow in ways you never have before!

The conscious couple is fiercely committed to being the embodiment of love. And through their devotion and practice, love shows up in their lives and relationship in ways they would've never imagined before.

title: Islam
text:
Islam - much of it's growth is owed to its rapid conversion of certain segments of western society.

At a glance it defies all logic, but it's true. It's a commonly held view that when a person stops believing in organized religion they don't then believe in nothing, but begin to believe in anything. This describes the state of many in the post-secular west. And for people in that mental and emotional state, divorced from their society without any common emotional ground to bind them to their family and community, Islam apparently has some intrinsic appeal. But this then begs the question "Who are these people?" Who would be willing to give up so much of the promise of the 21st century west for the cold restricted structure of 4th century Islam? Who would be prepared to trade the "We hope you believe but it's really up to you" optimism of western theology for the choice between unyielding submission to the political hierarchy of the faith, or the business end of the faithful's sword?

Well in a word... its losers. Islam is growing in the western world by picking the low hanging fruit of society. Those most lacking in the skills it takes to succeed in the west, are irresistibly drawn to Islam. In a single stroke, Islam provides not only the craved for structure of a rigid life and a ready political apparatus which blames others for their hardships, but provides the promise of eternal reward in heaven for the very characteristics which have brought them only failure in the west. In short, it's a religion which rewards the loser for the very things which make them a loser, and encourages them to use violence to bring the rest of society down to their level. This is why it's becomes such a popular faith in the US prison systems, and why it's growing so rapidly among the discontented portions of western society. Whatever your personal failure, Islam has an explanation that makes it clear that someone else is responsible. 

In the history of man, no society has so successfully provided each individual with opportunity like the United States. In the US, the circumstances of your birth don't matter, nor does your race, nor your gender, or anything else other than your own personal initiative. In America, both men and women from every religious, racial, ethnic, and economic subgroup have continually reached the pinnacle of success in their chosen fields. And the world over it's widely regarded as fact that if you are truly extraordinary at something, then America is where you will receive the greatest reward for it. America loves a winner, and our society rewards them well. We recruit them in every slice of life, from athletes, to engineers, to writers to educators, and everything else. If there is a greatest ditch digger on the planet, then the odds would be that he's digging a ditch somewhere in the US. And it's the very idea "that success can come to anyone" which makes the US what it is. 

But that isn't to say that it's a perfect meritocracy where only those who deserve it are rewarded. It's still a society of men, and many of those men, for whatever reason, will do what they must to stand in the way of others as well. So while the opportunity is clearly there, that alone is not a guarantee of success. Some people, for whatever reason, lack the initiative, or the determination, or sometimes even the intelligence to achieve the same level of success as others in their chosen field. But the question of success is not what you start out with in life, but what you do with it. The people who achieve success are usually those who when faced with an obstacle will work harder, jump higher, run faster, and do whatever is necessary to get around it. Success isn't defined by talent as much as it is by determination. But some people don't react that way. Some people, when faced with an obstacle, will be quick to abandon their effort, and begin blaming others for their troubles. They fail to take responsibility, and instead look to find a scapegoat. And along comes Islam.

The very core concept of Islam is the unconditional surrender to the will of Allah. At its very heart, Islam encourages its faithful to not take responsibility for the circumstances of their life. And from that basis all other Islamic law follows. Have you had trouble with women? No problem... under Islam a woman is more a piece of property than a person, so you will be able to command, and they must obey, if not... it's the sword or stoning. Have you had trouble in business? No problem... under Islam, most worldly matters of commerce are left to the Dhimmi, those members of the unfaithful tolerated under Islam like slaves thanks to the high taxes paid by them for the right to survive. But if the taxes should stop flowing, or the Dhimmi become defiant, then Islam provides a solution that even a loser can understand, again, it's the sword. On and on, Islamic law makes it clear that if you are among the faithful, then anytime the world fails to meet your expectations, the perfectly acceptable and moral solution is violence.

In short, Islam is a belief system which codifies a theological structure where those people least capable of achieving success on their own gain the political means of either taking or restricting the success of others by force. title: Anything but ordinary
text:
I'm here to tell you a story. Our story, in fact.

Walking into the warm, cozy venue; our gaze meets almost immediately. The pictures we'd exchanged over the past few days helped prepare me for you - for the abundance of life in your eyes, the way they radiate pure joy when you smile - but then that grin creeps slowly, cautiously to you lips and my confidence wavers. I'm hoping that it doesn't show as we draw nearer and try to disguise my trepidation with a welcoming smile of my own. The one that I use and think is disarming and endearing, though with you I have my doubts that it will work.

Imagine our surprise and delight when the conversation flows easily, seemlessly. We joke about how it's weird to meet people from the Internet. Any moments of quiet (and there are few) are comfortable, contemplative and serene. This initial meeting has us regaling one another with stories from our pasts, all the while thinking of our future. Is there one here? Does he like me? Does she like me? 

The answer to our questions is, however, evident in our exuberant and excited conversation. Each of us being drawn more and more out of our shells, we're becoming more animated, more ourselves with each passing minute. 

Time, in situations such as this, seems to have lost its meaning. During a lull in the conversation we realize how late it is and that, unfortunately, we both have to work in the morning. As we leave, I offer to walk you back to your car, an offer that you were hoping for - neither of us want the night to end, but we know that it must and that there will be other nights. We walk slowly back to your car and as we walk, I reach out and take your hand in mine. The revelry in our touch is electric. We make it to your car and give one another a lingering good night hug, promising each other that we'll talk tomorrow. Hoping that we'll get to see each other again soon. 

And we do. The next day passes by in a blur fueled by thoughts of one another. In the weeks, months and years that follow we've progressed from idle banter to meaningful conversations we can't have with anyone else. We've move from hand holding through a vast spectrum. We've vowed to help each other grow and flourish. We've gone from wanting someone to hold to needing each other emotionally and physically.

You and I, we've built a life together. It's not one that most people would ever dream of but it's one that will be just as fulfilling and heartfelt as any there ever has been. It will be filled with joys, tragedies, arguements, growth, compromise, love and understanding. 

I'm ready to keep building, to keep cultivating the life I've always imagined. And that life involves you.

Now, you have a choice. You can choose to ignore this story, to ignore me. You can choose to go back to your daily routine as if you'd never read it. Maybe you'll wonder what kind of person I am, what would have happened if you had started talking to me, could we have built a life together? The life that we both dream of finding with another person?

But then again, why wonder what if? Take a shot. Dare to leap into the unknown, murky waters and see exactly where our story leads. It could be nowhere, but it's time to find out.

title: Looking for something real
text:
I have to laugh a little when I see posts that start with "I never thought I'd find myself on Craigslist," or "I probably won't find what I'm looking for on Craigslist." The thing I've found is CL is actually where I have the most luck in meeting new people compared to other online dating venues. Does it compare to actually meeting people out in the real world? No, but, for those of us that are shy or introverted, or something else that causes us to have difficulty with just striking up conversations with people we don't know in public areas like a bar, bookstore, grocery store, what have you, this is a way that we can simulate a similar scenario but have that helpful barrier of a glowing screen.

So, with that being said, here's giving this a try. I've tried this before and have met some interesting people, even had a few dates. Unfortunately none have worked out where I would have liked, some were just looking for someone to talk to, many the chemistry just wasn't there when it came time to actually meeting. I hold nothing against most of them, if it's not right, it's not right. 

About me; I'm 33, live alone with my dog in what he believes to be his house, have a car and a job working overnights in manufacturing. My free time is spent usually with friends playing one of the table top role playing games we enjoy, experimenting with different home brew recipes a couple friends and I find or create, or cross stitching. When I'm not with friends I'm usually watching something on Netflix, out with my dog at the park or for a walk, or I might be playing a video game. My musical interests range just about everything but most often I'l be listening to instrumentals. I can't really think of more to add at this point so if I seem like someone you'd like to talk to and get to know or if you have any further questions about me feel free to ask.

title: Romantic? Yeah - Why not. Let's just call it that...
text:
Occasionally I get to thinkin' about "What could've been" - Ya' know, that fork in the road where it all could've been right but, instead, it all went wrong. Since then, I've come to accept a lot of truths that I'd rather not accept about your kind (don't worry - Before you go pointing your finger calling me sexist, know that I'd like nothing more than equality, and I gave you much more than the benefit of the doubt, but you failed me innumerable times, which is what led to these conclusions).

In all honesty, the girl that comes to mind when I think about these kinda' things is prolly more along the lines of "the average woman" than I'd like to admit - That's just a watered-down way of saying, I never should've relied on her to make the right choice from the beginning, 'cuz very few of you do. But I was naive once - As much as you see a hateful sexist man, those impressions were not created out of thin air; They were created by you (hell - I was even resistant to the idea - Thinkin' that I must just be unlucky!).

She's married with a kid now - Has been for quite some time. Although I wish nothing more than to never see her again for the sake of not being reminded of what I can't have, part of me just wants a break from this reality where women are horrible human-beings, and I can hope for happiness, and maybe a delusional moment where I can be with her, and she'll accept the beautiful feelings I have for her, but that will never happen - Those feelings are, and always have been, threatening and ugly to her. I don't want to see her because I don't want to be reminded of what I can't have - She doesn't want to see me because she loaths me, without justification, and doesn't want to face that ugly part of herself, like most women, so she prefers that she doesn't have the displeasure of facing it - She prefers to live in her own delusion where she never met me, or had to tell me to fuck off in favor of men who cared for her only a fraction of how much I did.

It wouldn't be so bad if I could find one of you that disproves what I've found to be true about your kind (again: SEXIST PIG!), but unfortunately, you guys disproving my impressions of you seems to be pretty fucking low on your list of priorities. And, by this time in our lives, your true nature is blurred, since you very well could've been a deplorable cunt at one time, but was humbled by time - A single mother who would've laughed at the idea of dating someone like me, but now that you have a kid or two, you're desperate to find a father figure, and someone who'll stick around for more than just fuck-time, even though your pursuit of such a man is still somewhat an extension of your manipulative, self-absorbed outlook that let a piece of shit seed you and bail in the first place.

Are we colonizing Mars yet? Where can I go to avoid this? Any doctors out there that can change the fact that my happiness is loosely tied to you horrible bitches being pleased with my company?

Even if today I found the absolute perfect woman, I would (and should be) fuckin' pissed. That said, you don't need to give me the "There is no such thing as a 'perfect woman'" speech - Believe me, I know. 'Perfect woman' would be relative to the 'Average woman' and, in all honesty, at this point, she wouldn't even really be that good - She'd just be minimally tolerable.

That's the precedent women have created for themselves relative to halfway decent men: We know we're not wanted - You'd much rather fuck sociopaths, insecure assholes, manipulative pieces of shit, and just overall scumbags. The most we can hope for is to get the leftovers of the ungrateful assholes you love to fuck, and end up with a halfway tolerable situation.

And how poorly does that reflect on women, let-alone our society, and how I should feel when someone is singing the national anthem? Am I supposed to feel a swell of pride knowing that a majority of you pieces of shit wouldn't bother hearing me out beyond a paragraph, yet I'm supposed to go 'protect you' by killing strangers with a rifle at the order of whatever asshole in a suit (or soon-to-be 'cunt', 'cuz you're about to vote Hillary into office for absolutely no other reason than she has the same genitals as you)? Why the fuck would any man be happy with his place in this society, unless he was extremely wealthy and/or one of the many manipulative fucking pieces of shit you love to fuck?

The funny thing is, when I think back to her rejecting me, and the kind of guys I've heard have successful relationships, and sex-lives, it's just painful to comprehend. You claim you want a nice guy who cares for you - You don't - You never have wanted that. Those guys have come and gone in your life - You chose not to be with them. What you want is a controlling prick who takes you for granted, so you can say to yourself "Wow - He really barely wants me. text:
Maybe you and I are both looking for that best friend and lover. No drama here, just a regular guy looking for her.
I have been here 3 years now. I work regular M-F 8-5 hours. I moved here from about an hour away after a divorce. I bought a little 1940s built house and have enjoyed my independence and new found quiet time in fixing it up and making it my own. I enjoy putzing around the house and yard.
But now I am missing that connection with a woman and really ready to start finding her. Get out of the house sometimes, have fun, have conversations, the playful banter and see where it leads. At this stage of life the dating sites seem too much like having a part time job. An interview process ! Haha. 
I am happy, healthy, exercise, and just enjoy each day as I can. And the quality nap on a weekend haha. I am 54, 5'8", slimmer build. Professional. Neat and clean cut.
Not complicated, no drama. We both have our busy lives, are content and self sufficient, but are missing that connection. After a divorce, your mutual friends go by the wayside, and the distance for the guy friends just seems to keep us from getting together. And your work friends are just that, you need to keep yourself guarded a bit. So I am really ready to just have that one person nearby that you can call or text and say "hey, what are you doing? . . . Do you want to ....?"

So I just wanted to assure you that I am just a normal guy looking to start something with a sensual woman. So this is not too complicated for me, I am really ready. Ready for that friend. And I wanted to just say if you are not interested, I am not some weirdo that would continue to bug you or try to contact you. I'm too busy for that and would just move on looking for that friend. Just say so that I could know that.

I guess I am looking for two things in my life, they could be mutually exclusive, but it would be awesome if they were encompassed in the same woman. The one side is a female friend to hang with and see where it leads. Get out on regular dates for whatever we feel up to. A nice dinner or the dive bar for a burger and a beer. Good conversation, someone to share the "what's going on in your life these days?". Share the stories, outside of our politically correct workday daily lives. Or the art fair, a movie in or out, ballgame, the bookstore, people watching, whatever. The little road trips. For a guy, hanging around with a woman can be so much more interesting, especially at this stage of life.

On the other side I want to meet a sensual woman. I know what you are thinking, but no I am not that guy! A woman that doesn't just "like" sex, she "loves" sex. It is a part of her being more like a need than a want. She can be a little naughty. Like a little note or text that says "I want to see you, when are you free?" She wants the "God, I really needed that", sometimes. The next day she has a little smile through her day and feels good about her new found friend and how he makes her feel.
So there, I got it all out. Not perfect and not looking for perfect. Just the one.

The foundation of this relationship is conventional. The cornerstones are mutual attraction, shared intellectual and emotional maturity and that respect and appreciation for having found one another, exhibited in how much we enjoy times shared together.

What sets this relationship apart and makes others uneasy is that the sexuality we feels towards each other sizzles. It is overtly evident in how we stand together, walk together, talk together and the looks of mischief that flash from our eyes. It is demonstrated in how we kiss or touch in public without one iota of concern as to what anyone else might think. If it feels good...if it feels right...if the moment calls...we are connected.

That you are a 'good girl' and I a 'gentleman' should be readily apparent by our demeanors when we meet. You can not hide such personality traits. We'll know that intuitively about each other. What is different this time around is that by responding to this ad, you are unashamedly raising and waving your hand and professing that yes...your sexual needs and desires also matter. A lot.

We're cutting through a whole lot of posturing and relationship bullshit. To that I say, "Game on."

title: Looking in all the wrong places..... probably
text:
I have to laugh a little when I see posts that start with "I never thought I'd find myself on Craigslist," or "I probably won't find what I'm looking for on Craigslist." The thing I've found is CL is actually where I have the most luck in meeting new people compared to other online dating venues. Does it compare to actually meeting people out in the real world? No, but, for those of us that are shy or introverted, or something else that causes us to have difficulty with just striking up conversations with people we don't know in public areas like a bar, bookstore, grocery store, what have you, this is a way that we can simulate a similar scenario but have that helpful barrier of a glowing screen.

So, with that being said, here's giving this a try. I've tried this before and have met some interesting people, even had a few dates. Unfortunately none have worked out where I would have liked, some were just looking for someone to talk to, many the chemistry just wasn't there when it came time to actually meeting. I hold nothing against most of them, if it's not right, it's not right. 

About me; I'm 33, live alone with my dog in what he believes to be his house, have a car and a job working overnights in manufacturing. My free time is spent usually with friends playing one of the table top role playing games we enjoy, experimenting with different home brew recipes a couple friends and I find or create, or cross stitching. When I'm not with friends I'm usually watching something on Netflix, out with my dog at the park or for a walk, or I might be playing a video game. My musical interests range just about everything but most often I'l be listening to instrumentals. I can't really think of more to add at this point so if I seem like someone you'd like to talk to and get to know or if you have any further questions about me feel free to ask.

title: Date on Valentine's weekend?
text:
I have to laugh a little when I see posts that start with "I never thought I'd find myself on Craigslist," or "I probably won't find what I'm looking for on Craigslist." The thing I've found is CL is actually where I have the most luck in meeting new people compared to other online dating venues. Does it compare to actually meeting people out in the real world? No, but, for those of us that are shy or introverted, or something else that causes us to have difficulty with just striking up conversations with people we don't know in public areas like a bar, bookstore, grocery store, what have you, this is a way that we can simulate a similar scenario but have that helpful barrier of a glowing screen.

So, with that being said, here's giving this a try. I've tried this before and have met some interesting people, even had a few dates. Unfortunately none have worked out where I would have liked, some were just looking for someone to talk to, many the chemistry just wasn't there when it came time to actually meeting. I hold nothing against most of them, if it's not right, it's not right. 

About me; I'm 33, live alone with my dog in what he believes to be his house, have a car and a job working overnights in manufacturing. My free time is spent usually with friends playing one of the table top role playing games we enjoy, experimenting with different home brew recipes a couple friends and I find or create, or cross stitching. When I'm not with friends I'm usually watching something on Netflix, out with my dog at the park or for a walk, or I might be playing a video game. My musical interests range just about everything but most often I'l be listening to instrumentals. I can't really think of more to add at this point so if I seem like someone you'd like to talk to and get to know or if you have any further questions about me feel free to ask.

title: Making you feel like a woman

There's this new trend nowadays where people are afraid of disagreement and any kind of strife. I don't like it. I like to be able to be able to talk, and yes, sometimes even argue with people who hold different views. That's how I learn what makes sense and what doesn't! There's no need to get butthurt and hold grudges over someone thinking you're wrong. Obviously I don't want to argue, BUT I definitely don't want to tip-toe around things we don't agree on by saying things like "Ehhhh let's just change the subject. . .". WHY? Life isn't all sunshine and rainbows. In my opinion you learn most from the people who disagree with you, not just the people who flatter you and tell you how right you are.

I want an affectionate sweet girl who loves snuggling up on the couch while we watch some netflix. If you can cook, if your kitchen is your man trap, than by all means trap me baby! I don't mind if you like money, but if you're one of those chicks that could be in a youtube gold digger prank video, I want nothing to do with you. I don't care how hot/talented in bed you are. I find shyness in a girl to be feminine and endearing. It's actually kinda nice to watch you be shy at first and then slowly blossom and come out of your shell. I wanna make you feel secure so that you share your less superficial thoughts with me. 

I'm pretty athletic as well and ALWAYS willing to try a new sport. If you got a sport you love doing and looking for someone to share it with, I'm your guy. I'm pretty active but I've never really restricted myself to one particular activity. If you got one you love doing, let's do it!

I have a wall full of plaques that are supposed to attest to my "position" in the community and the world at large but they never meant that much to me as the harshest judge of me is ME.
I am in the process of retiring this year and have already sold most of my business interests and plan to take it easy and see the world. I do have three children from my single marriage and nine grandkids that I love so I can't get "lost" forever but I am free to do as I want and have the ability to capitalize on that freedom; a rare combination for most people; I'm blessed.
Financially I'm in great shape overall. I have saved enough money to live comfortably my remaining years; I own two nice homes, one with a private lake and in the country (I love to spend time in the country and am probably a country boy at heart. I love gardens fishing cuddling with a movie and taking walks for fitness and relaxation). Definitely not a big city man though I am at ease in the city but find it too crowded unfriendly and stressful overall. 
I also have a commercial office building two minutes from a Florida Beach; everything I own is paid for and I have way above average credit that I rarely use except to get points for travel. I eat a lot of organic and while I don't spend much on name brand goods, I spend liberally on travel, great food and drink and have always been a fantastic provider for my household which I hope soon includes you.
Physically I am overweight but still look good because I was athletic for many years and still have good musculature. All my hair, teeth and everything works with no "issues". No medications for anything and hardly ever take even an aspirin. I have always liked to drink and still drink too much but I am certainly no drunken alcoholic. I don't drink during the day and sometimes go days without but I do like my beer and wine OH and champagne. . ..! 
I write a few hours each day, practice music and exercise about an hour. These are my non-variables.
The down side: I did drugs for many years; smoked too much (now only a rare cigar). I was suspended from law practice for several years because of my drug involvement -- coke -- but was not disbarred. I have been arrested (28 years ago) but it has never stopped my successes. Perhaps because one of my best qualities is also on the down side list -- I am self-motivated sometimes to a fault. I have great references today including the Sheriff of my county and many prominent men whom I've had the pleasure of working with on projects of importance but I am not a saint and don't want a saint and though I am an imperfect Christian I don't wear it on my sleeve and do not want anyone sermonizing me or waiving morality in my face. Life is too shore and I want to enjoy it. 
I love sex but have had a lot of vanilla and now like things more uninhibited. I would love to find a lady who wouldn't mind stretching out in this regard. Perhaps bi-curious but definitely a freak between the sheets. Traveling internationally opens up a lot of possibilities for us to explore our sexuality and this is one of the things I've learned about myself. I cannot be with just one woman foregoing all others. I can be loyal to one woman and she can be my queen and only one living with me but for fun. . ..well, I want more. If you seek vanilla. . .I'm not the one. . ..a multi-flavored Neapolitan is my style. I don't want a mousy lady, but dominant won't work with me as I am a natural Dom and Alpha male, so submissive or neutral is great. That doesn't mean you can't get on top as I enjoy letting my lady run with her spirit as long as I feel respected and in charge. If you are sexy, smart (must be able to converse and have some wit) free to go and see the world and can go from jeans to gown to nude without compunction, we might have a fit. The BIG upside: I have enough dough to cover us both. If you have something to chip in please do but I got this. I do love the Credence Clearwater line. "You don't need a penny, just to hang around, but if you have a nickel, better lay your money down. 
I took time to write this and put though into it. Reply the same. I don't mind doing a rescue; I don't care about your past as much as I care about how you see your future. Think you need a real change, see me, I'm real and waiting. 
Send a full length photo or two and a detailed reply about your current situation including a synopsis of your sexuality. If we look like a fit, I'll reply with photos. If you like me, we can go to phone calls leading to a meet. I'm a man of action so no endless texters, sexters or computer avatars need apply.
Why Craigslist? Well why not, yes it is full of flakes but it reaches a LOT of people and I have met several great women on here they just couldn't pack up and travel around for a year or two and that's where my head is at. Also, I do know how to quickly separate the flakes, address collectors, email stealers, sex site solicitors and so on so don't waste your time though I know many will simply because they are not even reading this book I've written. title: Could you make it your personal responsibility to be less hatable?
text:
I've posted quite a few commentaries on you women-folk and how, collectively, you're mostly deplorable pieces of shit, BUUUHHHTTT, I've never really just flat-out asked if you would take it upon yourself to be an example of why men should not have a distaste for women. Ultimately, I think this could be the key element that keeps each woman I meet showing the same consistent pattern of being a horrible human-being.

... And whenever I make these pieces of writing (most call 'em rants, though I'm mostly calm and rational through the entirety of 'em, much like this one), one of the typical responses is this: "Not all women are like that!" The thing I find ironic about that response is it's never "I'm not like that!" And generally, if/when the person is willing to have a discussion beyond that, it becomes clear that when they say "Not all women are like that!", they're talking about someone other than themselves.

So, where the fuck is this woman that doesn't carry the negative traits typical to your gender? I dunno'... I know I've never met her, but you guys must know her, 'cuz you love to refer to her, even if she doesn't reflect what's true in your own life.

... Sooo, if you could take it upon yourself not to be a deplorable human-being, the world might be a slightly better place. I could lay out all the things that makes the average woman a deplorable human-being, but I dun' feel like writing all that, and you'd deny it regardless of whether it was true within your life anyways. So, again, I'm simply just going to ask you to take it upon yourself to be less hatable - Doubt many of you will be up to the task.

And, I know you guys have trouble with morality, so I'll just give you the most basic tip in Morality 101: "Do unto others as you would have them do unto you." When acting towards anyone (man, or woman), ask yourself how you would feel if someone did that to you. So when you receive a message from a guy, and you feel compelled to ignore it, ask yourself "If I put the effort into writing a worthwhile message trying to make a connection with another person and never got a response, would I feel positively about that, or negatively?" I know it's a lot easier to be a deplorable piece of shit, but if you could do me a personal favor and just give not being one a shot, I'd really appreciate it (a lot of other people would too)...

title: Valentine movie date night
text:
Seeking a date for Valentine's Day. I haven't had a decent V-Day since 2003! I know it's still pretty far off, but the thought here is we get to know each other between now and then, for your comfort and safety (priorities, man!)

SO. Here's what I'm thinking. We meet up at Sarna's at 40th & University, say 5:30. After dinner, we head to the Heights Theater for their Valentine's Day screening of a classic film, Sunrise. After that, anything goes; stay out, find somewhere to cuddle for awhile or just call it a night and go home.

Dinner is of course on me, as is the movie and any treats you might want at the theater. These classic shows tend to sell out or at least be super busy (I know, I work there) so the sooner we get rolling, the better!

The plot of the film is thus: Bored with his wife (Janet Gaynor), their baby and the dull routine of farm life, a farmer (George O'Brien) falls under the spell of a flirtatious city girl (Margaret Livingston) who convinces him to drown his wife so they can escape together. Of course nothing goes as planned in this film classic of true love and forgiveness.

Looking for someone twentysomething to around my age. Non-smoker preferred. Please send a pic with your reply with a description of yourself.

title: My life has become like the bad version of Groundhog Day
text:
If you haven't seen it, you should watch it. If you like the movie, we're somewhat on the same page.

Basically, my life is like that, except it doesn't have the happy ending, or even the positive things he gets to experience. Sure, I can and do improve myself. I play guitar and do other artistic things. I read Shakespeare. I love nature, challenging myself with physical activities. I don't drink or do drugs.

I watch great movies like The Holy Grail, Star Wars and other things generally enjoyed by people with nerdy tastes. But I'm not a nerd stereotype. I like haunted houses (I don't believe in ghosts or supernatural things though), fairs, festivals, 

I like the older rock, whether it's harder melodic stuff like Zeppelin, new wavy like the Cars, post punk, alternative, and so on. I also like classical, funk old R&B, and more. I just can't deal with most rap past the mid 90s, and country. 

And so, I do all these things, but I have no one to do them with. Obviously, I'm not an alcoholic that chases people away with my awful behavior. But sadly, that seems to be the problem. Most people are drawn to the misfits and assholes. It's hard finding healthy people who aren't mind numbingly stupid and/or boring. 

So I'm hoping to find someone with similar tastes and lifestyle choices. Because, while it might be great that you like Monty Python, I can't accept the fact that you're an obese crackhead. Or if you're in line with either the BLM people or Trump crowd. 

I just want my happy ending. No, I don't mean that in the seedy massage parlor way. Although a little nudge nudge wink wink would be more than welcome. I'm talking about finding someone of like mind whose company I cherish. Is that so much to ask for? I'm White, but color doesn't matter to me. What we have in common does.

Let me express this again. It should be clear, but it seems all the women on this site latch on to one thing and think that means we're a match. I want someone who has things in common with me in ALL the areas mentioned above. 

If you can't express yourself in something other than the typical cliches that people on here use about having a job and having their shit together instead of being able to express yourself more intelligently and articulately, if you are in shape but don't like nerdy things, and vice versa, we're NOT a match. 

I'm not saying I need you to like everything exactly the same, but it should be very similar. I don't think opposites attract, so if you're very far outside of what I mentioned, I know it won't work.

title: Uncertainty: hard-to-stomach fact #17
text:
Well, one would think that after 40-some years of facing the same reality, that one would eventually become accustomed to certain unassailable facts about it.

So why, then, is it so surprising, so raw, and so new, every time?

I speak, of course, of having a broken heart...

And what's the deal with yearning for someone long after they've made it clear that they want
nothing whatsoever to do with you?

What was it that Pascal said.... hmm... I think it was something to this effect:

"Love has its own reasons, of which reason itself is entirely unaware."

Anyhow, I'm clearly a good candidate for another broken heart. I seem to enjoy them.

(...& this may seem glib or sarcastic, but I think there must be a kernel of truth in it. After all, nothing makes one feel quite so alive as a broken heart.)

So please, get in touch! I seem to be in need of a new woman in my life.

-Max

"When your bow is broken
and your last arrow spent---
shoot! Shoot with all your heart."

-Anonymous

p.s. I will show you a pic of myself after we've begun communicating.

title: Midwest Chronicles, and then some. 5
text:
a thought

They had only met a few months ago and had only a few social events together, dinner, dance, a family gathering, their attraction was strong and their old fashioned values caused them both to be careful in their choices.
He had invited her to a weekend on the ice in a comfortable shanty, surrounded by Mother Nature and the frozen tundra, not camping mind you however the amenities were enough to get by and warm and comfortable sleep was always available, yes they were ice fishing on another of one of the great Minnesota lakes. This time was different as they both brought their dog from home to spend the weekend in the ice shelter, the dogs seem to get along well and fishing was good. it became dinner time and the wine was flowing the fish were biting the calm of the evening was upon them. She noticed as she was preparing the steaks on the small campfire stove that although his black lab, much larger and dominant male was both protecting as well as playfully pulling and nipping at her more submissive female and she commented......lucky girl
___________________

The way you smell when you come out of the shower makes you even more delicious. I love how you continue to wear that necklace as it is jokingly called because you and I know the leather you wear from me is the playful submissiveness you offer. As we sit on the couch together and watch an old movie the aroma of you encompasses my brain and all I can think about is wearing your fragrance with me tomorrow at work.
___________________________________________

I am domesticated, totally, yes house trained too....I have a soft side, but am manly as the next. Movies, in or out, dining the same, cooking together in a quaint kitchen with lots of counter space, fishing and boating in the summer, ice fishing in the winter, hunting in the fall, ain't Minnesota great?

title: Smartass seeking Smarter-ass
text:
So I'm beginning to think that I may be asking for too much... Is it unrealistic to find someone intelligent, witty, fit, sweet, and funny, and attractive? Or have they all been paired off with each other already? I suppose I could start walking up to random pedestrians on the street or start scouring the local night clubs looking for "fresh meat", but that's not really my style. If I wanted something meaningless, I'd go to a bar and look for it. But I'm looking for more. My job offers no social interaction and most of my friends have moved away, so my quest for REAL love has thrust me to the mecca of truth and substance known as Craigslist.

If you're the type of woman who measures self worth by the number of contacts stored in your cell phone or Facebook friends, I'm not interested. If you need to go out to a different bar or club every night of the week, I'm probably not the guy for you. I don't care about how educated you are or are not. I feel life's lessons are the only relevant ones in a relationship and I find charisma, wisdom and intelligence far more attractive than what's just skin deep. I want a companion, best friend and lover.....not a FWB or an activity partner. I like a girl who speaks her mind. If you feel or think something then do us both a favor and have the ovaries to say it. My crystal ball is no clearer than yours. But what you do for a living, where you live, who you've dated, what kind of clothes, car, living arrangement and lifestyle it affords you means pretty much nothing to me.

Ok, now here's me... the good, the bad, and the ugly.

The Good:

I'm 32 and tend to get along with younger and older women just the same. I'm not immature... Nor a cranky old man. I'm NOT a "serial dater".... one woman is all I want and need. I'm assertive, charming, devoted and very affectionate. Kind, but not weak. Sensitive and gentle.... a lover not a fighter and built for comfort, not speed. I'm independent and emotionally, financially, spiritually and mentally secure. I have 10 fingers and 10 toes. Oh and I have all my teeth. I'm well mannered, masculine, partially groomed, kind of domesticated and your parents will love me. I grew up with and love all animals but I'm a dog person... I have my own home and live on my own. I give kick-ass massages, I make a killer bubble bath, I'm housebroken, and I rarely leave the toilet seat down.

The bad:

I'm a perfectionist, impossibly stubborn, a clean freak, always procrastinate, and I'm damn good at arguing. I'm quiet at first until I sort people out, but I warm up fairly quickly. Introverted, but not shy. I NEED strong, reciprocal attraction.... I'm really not picky, and I know looks don't mean everything, but they do mean something. So call me shallow or superficial, but let's face it: it matters. I laugh at the stupidest shit. I'm a night owl and I'm a pain in the ass to wake up. I'm the product of the new generation... so blame that for whatever neurotic tendencies you're probably correct in assuming it produced. I call when I say I'm going to call and I expect the same from you. I'm mature and responsible when it matters, but my inner child is alive and kickin' and I've been told sometimes I'm too playful and over-use the "that's what she said" line.

At this point you may be thinking "what a self absorbed ass....". Not even close. Well, maybe a little... The point here is to paint a clear picture of myself so you don't end up biting off more than you can chew, which has happened more than once. I ain't easy, but I'm worth it!

You?

Kind, intelligent, witty, sweet, down to earth, cute, funny, sexy, sassy, seductive.... any or all of the above. I'm an honest 6'1" and 235 lbs. of sarcastic love machine... and I'm looking for smaller than me. I'm not saying you have to be stick thin... just be HWP... even being 5'10" and 180 lbs is fine... but a girl who's bigger than me isn't my type. Anyway, I'm also looking for someone responsible, affectionate, loyal, forthright and honest. And if you're a redhead and/or can sing, you're damn near "in", but still send me a message even if you're not. I'm no Adonis, but I'm no Steve Buschemi either.

Random facts and thoughts:

I'm an avid reader. I couldn't dance if my life depended on it. I believe in true love, but I'm not sold on love at first site yet. 'Arrested Development' is the greatest TV show of all time. The 80's had some of the best movies ever made. Everything is better when it's raining. I love to travel and it won't work if you don't have a passport. High heels are incredibly sexy. I'm a sucker for a killer smile. Late night runs to random destinations kick ass.

If I haven't sent you running to the hills, tell me about yourself and include your favorite color in the subject line so I know you're real and not some spam....

title: Ever struggled with physical/sexual intimacy and shame like I have?
text:
A lot of people reading this will think this is a joke or that I have some kind of ulterior motive. But this ad is not for those people. It's for those who, like me, have suffered in silence for years and are looking for some healing.

As a shy, conservative Christian male, I have for years had an unhealthy attitude towards my body and sexuality. This has manifested as depression, deep isolation and loneliness, and various sexual dysfunctions. At one point I couldn't even stand to look at myself in the mirror, or to evaluate a passerby woman's physical attractiveness, and I felt deep guilt and shame when I so much as woke up in the morning with an erection. It also meant no dates, even casual ones, for over a decade - to the point I thought I'd always be alone. It wasn't due to being particularly overweight or ugly or anything; I'd just learned to absolutely despise my desires as "evil" and a source of irreconcilable shame. But the desires continued all the same, which meant the shame was always with me.

Fortunately, I have since learned how to have a much healthier attitude, and to respect my (and others') bodies and sexuality. I understand now that sex is actually a good thing, and is meant to be just one component of a multifaceted, healthy, intimate relationship. Where we get it wrong is when we make a relationship just about sex or our own pleasure, and stop caring about the other person.

Why am I writing this? Because I have a gift for helping women who have struggled with the same things. To date, I've helped 3 women who struggled with their body images and/or sexual intimacy, aiding them in getting past their guilt, shame, or other issues, so that they can now live full, intimate, lives with full and healthy relationships. I'd like to help anyone else who is reading this and recognizes the same issues in themselves. And I'm doing so for free.

To be clear, what I am offering is to listen, to chat, or to interact in any way that will help you get past your shame and fears. It will be entirely at your own pace, and you'll know better than I will what you need. But I will push you to get out of your comfort zone and to abandon all modesty and fear in a completely nonjudgmental, completely safe, environment. Expect, for example, that at some point I will push you to go completely naked, and to masturbate yourself (or be masturbated) to orgasm. I will also push you to share any stories, history or secrets that you have kept locked up and hidden for years. And I will do the same if you wish. Such intimacy and openness, I have learned, helps to erode the years of guilt and shame that have built up, establishing a safe space for being completely open and honest with one another, and building trust and comfort.

If you are interested, I hope to hear from you. Send a description of yourself, why you are reaching out, and a photo (I encourage a full body nude photo, though that's certainly not required) and I will return the favor. Thank you for your consideration. (Unfortunately, at this time I'm only accepting single women; that may change in future.)

title: LTR with Age Difference
text:
You know who you are. You know what you need. You know what you like. You have high expectations when it comes to men (even here on CL).

Older men intrigue you--professional, established, sophisticated older men. They have something to say. They have an understated kind of confidence. Their maturity is a turn on. Women mature at a faster rate then men and you have tired of the insecurities and games that the man-boys your age play.

When you look in the mirror you see these two sides of you. One side is the pretty, educated/smart young woman who has the world by the balls. The other side is the softer, searching "little girl" who wants and needs an older man as an integral part of her life.

title: Uncertainty: hard-to-stomach fact #17
text:
Well, one would think that after 40-some years of facing the same reality, that one would eventually become accustomed to certain unassailable facts about it.

So why, then, is it so surprising, so raw, and so new, every time?

I speak, of course, of having a broken heart...

And what's the deal with yearning for someone long after they've made it clear that they want
nothing whatsoever to do with you?

What was it that Pascal said.... hmm... I think it was something to this effect:

"Love has its own reasons, of which reason itself is entirely unaware."

Anyhow, I'm clearly a good candidate for another broken heart. I seem to enjoy them.

(...& this may seem glib or sarcastic, but I think there must be a kernel of truth in it. After all, nothing makes one feel quite so alive as a broken heart.)

So please, get in touch! I seem to be in need of a new woman in my life.

-Max

"When your bow is broken
and your last arrow spent---
shoot! Shoot with all your heart."

-Anonymous

p.s. I will show you a pic of myself after we've begun communicating.
