I am a married man who is looking for a long term relationship with a married woman. Please do not flag this post, I am very real and I imagine there are plenty of people that are trying to get up the courage to do this very thing, so be kind and if you object simply move on. Thank you. 

I've been contemplating how exactly to word this post and I decided that what I'm not going to include is what led me to this point in my marriage. I'll happily share that info with anyone who has an interest in this endeavor as their story will likely be similar and those can be our stories to share and not the business of any general reader. 

I'm a white collar guy, 5'10", 180, and I've been told that I'm handsome but to each their own. Obviously attraction is a requirement but we can cross that bridge when we get there. 

One characteristic that I'm really firm on is that I am only looking for a married woman who also has contemplated this for a long time and has finally worked up the courage to take the leap. I know there are plenty of you out there that are staying when deep down you wish you didn't have to. Typically that is due to the kids in a marriage, but it could be for any number of reasons.

I've thought about this for quite some time and do not take anything like this lightly, as I would expect for whoever responds. Realizing that there are many types of arrangements that can be covered under the classification of an "affair", I figured I'd lay out some things that are a good representation of what I'm looking for and maybe that'll help a reader decide if we'd be a good match or not, ok? Good. 

I am looking for an unbreakable bond of friendship and trust that could blossom into an amazing physical relationship as well. One that is full of incredible conversation, laughter, passion, intimacy, trust, and all of the wonderful things that could someday grow into our own version of love. A special relationship. A bond. To grow with a person, to grow into something amazing. Everything that we both wish we could have with our spouse, but after all the hardship and continued efforts, just isn't meant to be in our marriages. I don't want to dwell on that, there will be plenty of chances to discuss our lives in private. I just want it to be clear that I'm not doing this to find five FWB's or five women that think they're the only one. I only want one and I want to be your only one. It's a relationship, hopefully based on trust. Yes, I see the irony in that statement, but anyone who feels how I do will understand exactly what I'm getting at. 

One aspect I've given a lot of thought to is the logistics behind two people having a discrete ongoing relationship that provides what both people are needing, all the while keeping the secret as the key component. If I new the best way to do things I'd write a book and make a killing, but I don't. So I envision this as a relationship filled with emails during the work days, phone calls just to say hi(or maybe it's one of those days when you would really care the sound of your lovers voice just to bring back the smile to your face). Then, whenever schedules allow, there can be time spent together over lunches or for a short time after work, even if just to steal a kiss. Being that our home lives would be our primary concerns I realize that getting together in person could be tricky, but I think it can be overcome if it's wanted bad enough. Just imagine the options that would be available if we both took a half day off of work....four hours for a picnic lunch, a walk around the lake to talk, or whatever. Either way, I think it can be done. Do you?

I think I could write another chapter of this book, easily, but I think I've gotten the bulk of the idea out there. 

If you're a married woman and finally ready to do something to put a smile in your face and I've piqued your interest then drop me a note to say hi. I don't have a lot of firm requirements other than you be married, 25-45, consider yourself attractive and you take care of yourself physically. I'm not looking for a gym nut, but I'm not attracted to BBW either, sorry. Most people with kids have some pounds they'd rather not have and that's fine, I do too, I'm just not attracted to BBW sorry. 

Thanks for reading and I hope to hear from you!

title: Read and Respond
text:
It takes two to tango! This could work out in a few different ways

Option A) You're really ridiculously good looking, but have cardboard for a personality. We agree on nothing, but still manage to love each other. This will work until it doesn't. This will end with screaming and violence. It will start again but of course end again.

Option B) We have absolutely everything in common. You love the things I love, and I love the things you love. Everything that bothers me, you start noticing bothers you as well. Anything you dislike is so horrid! We have such excellent preferences, and heck yes we are always right. This will continue indefinitely.

Option C) We have a few things in common, but what's more important is that we enjoy spending time together. We do whatever. Things are good, but not really great. It keeps on keeping on and if it ends it will be amicably.

Option D) You are so goofy! We always have a blast together, but for some reason those feelings that should be there just aren't. This will be hard to address, but I think it's because we are too different with not enough attraction towards one another.

Option E) You are the coolest of all cool dudes and so down to earth. There's nothing I can't say to you, and you're always there for when I have that one shitty thing to vent about. So what if it's just me being hangry? Dude, we're getting lunch NOW. We would be friends even if we were enemies, because you're just that cool. But maybe it ends because it's not exciting enough?

Option F) You are even more obsessive than I am. At first it's cute, and sweet. Yes, of course I love you. Then all you do is talk about how insecure you are. Then all you do is talk about how I don't build up your self esteem enough. What?! You're great, but it'll end because you aren't good enough for yourself.

Okay so maybe it doesn't fall into any of those specifically. 
I don't have a specific age range, but if you're an ogre I'm not sure even the most fantastic of a personality can compensate for that. Because of this, if you don't send a picture with your first or second response, I'll assume you're hiding your hideousity (yes I made this) from me in some weird attempt to trick me into loving you-- which obviously wouldn't work in the long run so let's cut the bulls#!t before it happens.
I have no pets. If you have a cat, though, I would like a picture of that as well. I'm not sharing numbers right away. I am not looking for a quick meet up. I don't want replies from people that don't know how to type. I don't want replies from people making excuses for why they happened to be browsing the personals. I don't want replies from people saying they're bored. I don't want replies from drug users. (sorry my preference for dating, nothing more. you're still human I know!) I don't want replies from people that have no introduction aside from asking about me.

I'm straightforward. I'm honest. I'm loyal. I'm creative.

One of my favorite questions one of my friends asked me was "What do you think the most romantic thing a person can do is?" My answer was apologize.

That's something interesting to talk about if you don't know how to start.

All relationships require the taking of a first step and opening up...being vulnerable...taking risk. This week, this weekend...let's begin what could be that first step of many we will take. The night might not be just a single step, either. If stars align, it will turn from a tentative walk into a very exciting foot race.

I have no firm plans tonight, and neither do you. We cast aside all dating rules and set up our date and rendezvous. We meet. We flirt. We get to know one another. We look into each other's eyes looking for those tell-tale signs. Or emboldened, we speak them aloud. There are no expectations. However, the night abounds with hopeful anticipation. It is a night to let go, actually enjoy the dating process as an adult, and without a shred of drama.

I am intelligent, VGL, professional. I have confidence that you'll find yourself in the captivating presence of a gentleman....and with enough rogue mixed in to keep you smiling and to stoke that anticipation to very exciting heights.

Don't be shy. Be bold. Don't be hesitant. Grab onto life. I'm posting. You're reading. This might be that intersection we've been looking for...the one that is so hard to find.

Prefer 40s and younger or with a very youthful and playful attitude and lifestyle. Slender to HWP and do so love women who are flirty, intelligent and can hold their own with banter.

What sets this relationship apart and makes others uneasy is that the sexuality we feels towards each other sizzles. It is overtly evident in how we stand together, walk together, talk together and the looks of mischief that flash from our eyes. It is demonstrated in how we kiss or touch in public without one iota of concern as to what anyone else might think. If it feels good...if it feels right...if the moment calls...we are connected.

That you are a 'good girl' and I a 'gentleman' should be readily apparent by our demeanors when we meet. You can not hide such personality traits. We'll know that intuitively about each other. What is different this time around is that by responding to this ad, you are unashamedly raising and waving your hand and professing that yes...your sexual needs and desires also matter. A lot.

We're cutting through a whole lot of posturing and relationship bullshit. To that I say, "Game on."

title: Uncertainty: hard-to-stomach fact #17
text:
Well, one would think that after 40-some years of facing the same reality, that one would eventually become accustomed to certain unassailable facts about it.

So why, then, is it so surprising, so raw, and so new, every time?

I speak, of course, of having a broken heart...

And what's the deal with yearning for someone long after they've made it clear that they want
nothing whatsoever to do with you?

What was it that Pascal said.... hmm... I think it was something to this effect:

"Love has its own reasons, of which reason itself is entirely unaware."

Anyhow, I'm clearly a good candidate for another broken heart. I seem to enjoy them.

(...& this may seem glib or sarcastic, but I think there must be a kernel of truth in it. After all, nothing makes one feel quite so alive as a broken heart.)

So please, get in touch! I seem to be in need of a new woman in my life.

-Max

"When your bow is broken
and your last arrow spent---
shoot! Shoot with all your heart."

-Anonymous

p.s. I will show you a pic of myself after we've begun communicating.

title: Flirty Night of Firsts
text:
We read M4W or W4M in hopes that against some pretty long, tall odds there is that someone out there reading or posting at the same time who are destined to share a part of our lives with. Someone normal. Very attractive. Someone who can rock our world. 

All relationships require the taking of a first step and opening up...being vulnerable...taking risk. This week, this weekend...let's begin what could be that first step of many we will take. The night might not be just a single step, either. If stars align, it will turn from a tentative walk into a very exciting foot race.

I have no firm plans tonight or tomorrow, and neither do you. We cast aside all dating rules and set up our date and rendezvous. We meet. We flirt. We get to know one another. We look into each other's eyes looking for those tell-tale signs. Or emboldened, we speak them aloud. There are no expectations. However, the night abounds with hopeful anticipation. It is a night to let go, actually enjoy the dating process as an adult, and without a shred of drama.

I am intelligent, VGL, professional. I have confidence that you'll find yourself in the captivating presence of a gentleman....and with enough rogue mixed in to keep you smiling and to stoke that anticipation to very exciting heights.

Don't be shy. Be bold. Don't be hesitant. Grab onto life. I'm posting. You're reading. This might be that intersection we've been looking for...the one that is so hard to find.

title: Sooner or later everyone
text:
either stops by CL for the first time or comes back to it! All the 'paid sites' are what they are to or for you. CL is without a doubt is raw at times & of course there are all the scams, bots & players to contend with but the alternates (eHarmoney, Match, Senior Sexy & whatever else you have tried) aren't any better - there are 1500 sites just like them to choose from. CL definitely has a wider spectrum of readers & posters hence a thinner middle ground. 

It's not easy to find a nice & decent woman on CL any more. It used to be. I am not sure why things have changed so but I think it has a lot to do with the single mindedness of some. At least that would be my take after reading a few of the mens postings for Sex, FWB, ONS, married woman, coc shots mailed to womans postings, mom's basement &/or shelter dwellers, druggies &/or alcoholics, it goes on & on. Unquestionably, older men are different from younger men who often lack maturity and certainly that confidence born from wisdom. No pretentiousness. No false bravado and silly games. You find yourself comfortably slipping into conversation with older men who show interest in you and actually (gasp) have something worthwhile to say.

You're also a rule breaker--or dream of being one who does. You admit that it would be a rush to date someone who isn't typically the norm for a woman your age. Being on his arm out in public and enjoying dates while out in public would be deliciously trippy as other's look on and discreetly stare.

It would be refreshing to let down your guard and just luxuriate in the now. To be uncensored. Carefree. And be with a man who will take a nurturing lead. One of those attractions you have towards older men is that the right one would be not just your partner and lover but also your mentor and your teacher.

Sexually, you know you'd soar. The naughtiness of breaking rules collides sexily with all of the attention and patience an older man would show you. Men of experience excite you...in that they are not rushed. Nor are they selfish. title: LTR with Age Difference
text:
You know who you are. You know what you need. You know what you like. You have high expectations when it comes to men (even here on CL).

Older men intrigue you--professional, established, sophisticated older men. They have something to say. They have an understated kind of confidence. Their maturity is a turn on. Women mature at a faster rate then men and you have tired of the insecurities and games that the man-boys your age play.

Personally, you'd love having not just a partner and lover but also an older mentor and teacher. It is exhausting keeping your defenses up and playing silly dating games. With an older man a certain kind of soft submissiveness within you would shine through and you could retreat into a very personal, nurturing and sensual world.

Admittedly, there is a pronounced "little girl" inside you that wants to be adored and coddled. That same "little girl" also needs to sometimes have her bullshit called and have some discipline and direction instilled into her world. Guys your age can't do that. They are still figuring out who they are, and don't have the insights, nerve and confidence to keep you properly on task.

When you look in the mirror you see these two sides of you. One side is the pretty, educated/smart young woman who has the world by the balls. The other side is the softer, searching "little girl" who wants and needs an older man as an integral part of her life.

I am handsome, accomplished, sincere and not looking for this to be some silly little one-off fantasy date but instead something that grows into a very deep connection.

title: You're Smart, Funny, Outgoing, Fit, Naughty...and Married
text:
As surprising as it may be, it's possible stumble across an ad that really resonates with you. An ad that genuinely catches your attention. You know immediately that it's different than all the others. And from the onset, you wonder if you should take a chance and reply. Maybe this is one of those ads. And maybe this is the time you finally take that chance.

So who is this guy posting? Well, I'm a very charismatic, charming, witty, and fun guy. I'm educated, professional, accomplished, and I have the ability to effectively communicate my thoughts and feelings better than most men. I'm also married. No games or lies here. But after many years, the relationship has evolved into more of a friendship. We simply grew in different directions. Looking back, I probably married too young and was somewhat naive about what I really wanted. And so I've come to CL hoping to find a woman who might be in a similar boat.

Physically, I'm 5'8" and quite fit. I know guys say they are fit, but still have a gut. Not me. I take care of myself. I watch what I eat and exercise 4-5 days a week. I would describe my body as athletic and well proportioned. I have soft, fair skin, all my hair, nice teeth, and I maintain impeccable hygiene. No tattoos, or piercings, and I'm completely clean.

I'm searching for that very rare unicorn. I'm searching for an outgoing, smart, fit, emotionally mature woman who wants an amazing friendship first and foremost. But a secret friendship nonetheless. I'm looking for a connection where we can both be free and open to talk about and explore all the things that have been pent up for much too long. A friendship with anticipation, flirting, laughter, long conversations, travel, shopping, dining, and passionate intimacy. 

Perhaps you're a career woman or even a stay-at-home mom. You're smart yet curious. You can dress up for a night out or just as easily throw on some sweatpants to cuddle up. You have a great sense of humor. You have a quick wit and appreciate expertly timed sarcasm. You consider yourself healthy and you take care of your body. Maybe some have even described you as a hopeless romantic. But you're not afraid to express yourself. Whatever the case may be, you're needing more fulfillment in your life. Something that makes your heart race again.

On the outside people view you as having your act together. You have an exceptional head on your shoulders. You get it. However, on the inside and in private, you sneak away to CL from time to time and look. You have that secret, naughty side that needs attention and exploring. You want the butterflies. You need to feel alive. And you can only do that with the right man. Guess what... he's out there. And you CAN find him on CL. Maybe you just did. 

I've successfully experienced this in the past, and so I know it's more than possible for two people to meet this way. But what I've learned is that in order for this to happen successfully there must be a connection of the minds. There needs to be chemistry, respect, trust, and mutual physical attraction. Too many people here are just looking for sex. They forget that the only way to have genuine intimacy and excitement is to have a solid foundation. It's much too important, and it takes a little time to build. 

Look, I don't love the fact that I'm posting an ad on CL, given the reputation of the masses. And you're not the type of woman who would ever consider replying. But maybe this is the time you finally take that chance. There aren't too many outlets to connect with people in a similar situation. And it's not like we can advertise in public. Discretion is paramount. And if I don't post an ad, I won't have much of a chance in finding you. So take a moment to reply, won't you? You'll be pleasantly surprised to know that you can find a great guy like me here. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: You're Intelligent, Outgoing, Witty, Professional, Fit... and Married
text:
Every once in a while you stumble across an ad that really resonates with you. An ad that genuinely catches your attention. You know immediately that it's different than all the others. And from the onset, you wonder if you should take a chance and reply. Maybe this is one of those ads. And maybe this is the time you finally take that chance.

So who is this guy posting? Well, I'm a very charismatic, charming, witty, and fun guy. I'm educated, professional, accomplished, and have the ability to effectively communicate my thoughts and feelings. I'm also married. No games or lies here. But after many years, the relationship has evolved into more of a friendship. We simply grew in different directions. Looking back, I probably married too young and was somewhat naive about what I really wanted. And so I've come to CL hoping to find a woman who might be in a similar boat.

Physically, I'm 5'8" and quite fit. I know guys say they are fit, but still have a gut. Not me. I take care of myself. I watch what I eat and exercise 4-5 days a week. I would describe my body as athletic and well proportioned. I have soft, fair skin, all my hair, nice teeth, and I maintain impeccable hygiene. No tattoos, or piercings, and I'm completely clean.

I'm searching for that rare unicorn. I'm searching for an outgoing, smart, fit, emotionally mature woman who wants an amazing friendship first and foremost. But a secret friendship nonetheless. I'm looking for a connection where we can both be free and open to talk about and explore all the things that have been pent up for much too long. A friendship with anticipation and flirting and laughter and fun and travel and shopping and dining and passionate intimate explorations. 

Perhaps you're a career woman or even a stay-at-home mom. You're smart yet curious. You can dress up for a night out or just as easily throw on some sweatpants to cuddle up. You have a great sense of humor. You consider yourself healthy and you take care of your body. Maybe some have even described you as a hopeless romantic. But you're not afraid to express yourself. Whatever the case may be, you're needing more fulfillment in your life. Something that makes your heart race again.

On the outside people view you as having your act together. You have an exceptional head on your shoulders. You get it. However, on the inside and in private, you sneak away to CL from time to time and look. You have that secret side that needs attention and exploring. You want the butterflies. You need to feel alive. And you can only do that with the right man. Guess what... he's out there. And you CAN find him on CL. Maybe you just did. 

I've experienced this in the past, and so I know it's more than possible. But what I've learned is that in order for this to happen successfully there must be a connection of the minds. There needs to be chemistry, respect, trust, and mutual physical attraction. Too many people here are just looking for sex. They forget that the only way to have genuine intimacy and excitement is to have a solid foundation. It's much too important, and it takes a little time to build. 

Look, I don't love the fact that I'm posting an ad on CL, given the reputation of the masses. And you're not the type of woman to typically reply to an ad. But maybe this is the time you finally take that chance. There aren't too many outlets to connect with people in a similar situation. And it's not like we can advertise in public. Discretion is paramount. And if I don't post an ad, I won't have much of a chance in finding you. So do take a few minutes to reply, won't you? You would be pleasantly surprised to know that a guy like me has an ad on here. I'm not cocky or arrogant in the least. But I do know that I'm a great guy and even better catch. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: You're Outgoing, Fun, Witty, Fit, Married, & Looking to Fill the Void
text:
It's rare, but every once in a while you can stumble upon an ad that really resonates with you. An ad that genuinely catches your attention. You recognize pretty quickly that it's different than all the other ads. And from the onset, you wonder if you should take a chance and reply. Maybe this is one of those ads. And maybe this is the time you finally take that chance.

So who am I? Well, I'm a very charismatic, charming, witty, successful, and funny guy. I'm educated, professional, accomplished, and have the ability to effectively communicate my thoughts and feelings better than most men. I'm also married. No games or lies here. But after many years, the relationship has evolved into more of a friendship. We simply grew in different directions. Looking back, I probably married too young and was somewhat naive about what I really wanted. And so I've come to CL hoping to find a woman who might be in a similar boat.

Physically, I'm 5'8" and quite fit. I take care of myself. I watch what I eat and exercise 4-5 days a week. I would describe my body as athletic and well proportioned. I have soft, fair skin, all my hair, nice teeth, and I maintain impeccable hygiene. No tattoos, or piercings, and I'm completely clean.

I'm searching for that ultra rare unicorn. I'm searching for an outgoing, smart, witty, physically healthy, emotionally mature woman who wants an amazing friendship first and foremost. But a secret friendship nonetheless. I'm looking for a connection where we can both be free and open to talk about and explore all the things that have been pent up for much too long. A friendship with anticipation and flirting and laughter and fun and travel and shopping and dining and long conversations and passionate explorations. 

Perhaps you're a career woman or even a stay-at-home mom. You're smart yet curious. You can dress up for a night out or just as easily throw on some sweatpants to cuddle up. You have a great sense of humor. You consider yourself healthy and you take care of your body. Maybe some have even described you as a hopeless romantic. But you're not afraid to express yourself. Whatever the case may be, you're needing more fulfillment in your life. Something that makes your heart race again.

On the outside people view you as having your act together. You have an exceptional head on your shoulders. You get it. However, on the inside and in private, you sneak away to CL from time to time and look. You have that secret side that needs attention and exploring. You want the butterflies. You need to feel alive. And you can only do that with the right man. Guess what... he's out there. And you CAN find him on CL. Maybe you just did. 

I've experienced this in the past, and so I know it's more than possible. But what I've learned is that in order for this to happen successfully there must be a connection of the minds. There needs to be chemistry, respect, trust, and mutual physical attraction. Too many people here are just looking for sex. They forget that the only way to have genuine intimacy and excitement is to have a solid foundation. It's much too important, and it takes a little time to build. 

Look, I don't love the fact that I'm posting an ad on CL, given the reputation of the masses. And you're not the type of woman to typically reply to an ad. But maybe this is the time you finally take that chance. There aren't too many outlets to connect with people in a similar situation. And it's not like we can advertise in public. Discretion is paramount. And if I don't post an ad, I won't have much of a chance in finding you. So do take a few minutes to reply, won't you? You'll be pleasantly surprised to find a great guy like me on here. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Super powers limited to hailing taxi's.
text:
I'm a hard working, funny, intelligent, independent thirty three year old male who tends to focus on the positive in life and speak what's on his mind. I dislike whiners and complainers, life is what you make of it, and everyone has the power to make it better. I hate liars and do believe the smallest lie is more hurtful then the harshest truth. I do my own laundry, cleaning, cooking, ironing, car maintenance, etc. I can be very competitive and often push myself if I feel I am not giving something one hundred percent effort. I am always cracking jokes, and can be a bit sarcastic, so you must have a sense of humor and able to throw jokes my way. I am a huge Minnesota sports fan; especially of the Vikings. I am a season ticket holder (already have seats for the new stadium). I also follow the Wild, Twins and Gophers. I spent twelve years in the Army, and did numerous tours overseas and even though I am out, volunteer in a few service organizations to help fellow veterans. I enjoy being outdoors; fishing, hunting, biking, kayaking, having BBQs, camping, star gazing, or just sitting around a camp fire with friends talking and joking. If I can't be outdoors, you will find me playing darts, pool, bowling, reading, watching movies, listening to music, or occasionally playing a video game. I am always looking for a reason to throw on a suit to go out for an evening, so you have to enjoy dressing up from time to time.

What am I looking for? I would like to meet someone who could be a friend even if we don't have that connection that transcends into a romantic relationship. You have to be strong minded, smart, caring, and able to hold a conversation without having to dumb yourself down in attempt to make others like you. Intelligence is a turn on to me. You have to have an appreciation of the outdoors, take a drive out into the country and star gaze, or just willing to try something new things in life. Having confidence and being full of one's self are two entirely different things; life is easier when you know the boundary. I love doing romantic things to show my girl I do care and think about her; so I am not one of those guys that goes all out for Valentine's Day only to make up for not doing anything the other 364 days of the year. If you get to know me, you may be pleasantly surprised by the person you're taking the chance of becoming friends with..

title: Looking for a real connection
text:
I have to laugh a little when I see posts that start with "I never thought I'd find myself on Craigslist," or "I probably won't find what I'm looking for on Craigslist." The thing I've found is CL is actually where I have the most luck in meeting new people compared to other online dating venues. Does it compare to actually meeting people out in the real world? No, but, for those of us that are shy or introverted, or something else that causes us to have difficulty with just striking up conversations with people we don't know in public areas like a bar, bookstore, grocery store, what have you, this is a way that we can simulate a similar scenario but have that helpful barrier of a glowing screen.

So, with that being said, here's giving this a try. I've tried this before and have met some interesting people, even had a few dates. Unfortunately none have worked out where I would have liked, some were just looking for someone to talk to, many the chemistry just wasn't there when it came time to actually meeting. I hold nothing against most of them, if it's not right, it's not right. 

About me; I'm 33, live alone with my dog in what he believes to be his house, have a car and a job working overnights in manufacturing. My free time is spent usually with friends playing one of the table top role playing games we enjoy, experimenting with different home brew recipes a couple friends and I find or create, or cross stitching. When I'm not with friends I'm usually watching something on Netflix, out with my dog at the park or for a walk, or I might be playing a video game. My musical interests range just about everything but most often I'l be listening to instrumentals. I can't really think of more to add at this point so if I seem like someone you'd like to talk to and get to know or if you have any further questions about me feel free to ask.

title: Dear Mrs. Someday
text:
Dear Mrs. Someday,



I've had a glass of wine so I found the courage to write to you. It is near midnight so maybe you won't see this but I just have to get the words out. It has been a while since I've thought of you but I find that you are on my mind a lot lately. I'm not entirely sure that I'm really READY for you, but I want to be ready - I'm "ready to be ready" as a friend once put it.

Of course, I long for you most of all on those long and exhausting days of work, when I'm driving home and all that I want, more than anything in the world, is to come home to your beautiful smile, or a pleasant and new surprise... or maybe you're working late and I can surprise you by turning the table with a meal that I've come up with... the couch seems lonely without you there to cuddle with.

I thought I was ready for you a few months ago but I made a mistake instead. That was a big lesson that I needed to learn. And so now I'm going on with my life... learning about myself, accepting my dominating and "larger than life" sides; accepting the primal animal within; accepting the kind of woman that I need as my counterpart.

You would be quite the package... I hope I could live up to what you deserve, as you are here I know you are searching, and, moreso, I hope that you can live up to what I think I deserve. I've been through a lot, you see... and I need an understanding person. Yes, a hand of compassion - but also a bomb defuser for those damn emotional landmines. I've gotten pretty good at identifying them (and defusing them myself) but having a partner a gentle embrace, to retreat to after the explosions... I need that. I sure do hope that you can understand all the various things that I need. I have so much to offer... but not to just anyone.

I am looking forward to the way you make me smile and laugh and giggle; I am looking forward to wrestling with you, holding you and being held by you, cooking for you, and allowing all of what I am to come out in a color revealing form. I am looking forward to receiving ideas to ponder, drying your tears when they flow , to affirm and adore you, love and protect you. I am looking forward to resting in each others arms, you laying your head on my lap, becoming a single entity, and feeling the gentleness of your kiss against mine. I am looking forward to the adventures that we will have and the lazy days/nights we will share.... and ALL that we will share, of ourselves. I am looking forward to *SO* much with you.

You'll find that when we meet my whole personality and spark will be to you liking, ... IF you care that much about such things, my smile and my personality would hopefully keep your heart glad.

So much of me is excited to meet you... I can't wait to see the way your eyes glitter, or how you cant your head when you have a seductive idea, or the way your eyes will turn darker when you become utterly serious, or the various little tells that give away your state of mind... and your smell, oh how important a scent may be - I know that now maybe is not the time. So I am practicing patience and live in hope

Someday we will rest in each others arms.... and we will be each others. I look forward to that day. I know you are out there, somewhere, why is it so hard to find you?

With Love,

Mr. Patiently-Waiting

title: You're Intelligent, Outgoing, Witty, Professional, Fit... and Married
text:
Every once in a while you stumble across an ad that really resonates with you. An ad that genuinely catches your attention. You know immediately that it's different than all the others. And from the onset, you wonder if you should take a chance and reply. Maybe this is one of those ads. And maybe this is the time you finally take that chance.

So who is this guy posting? Well, I'm a very charismatic, charming, witty, and fun guy. I'm educated, professional, accomplished, and have the ability to effectively communicate my thoughts and feelings. I'm also married. No games or lies here. But after many years, the relationship has evolved into more of a friendship. We simply grew in different directions. Looking back, I probably married too young and was somewhat naive about what I really wanted. And so I've come to CL hoping to find a woman who might be in a similar boat.

Physically, I'm 5'8" and quite fit. I know guys say they are fit, but still have a gut. Not me. I take care of myself. I watch what I eat and exercise 4-5 days a week. I would describe my body as athletic and well proportioned. I have soft, fair skin, all my hair, nice teeth, and I maintain impeccable hygiene. No tattoos, or piercings, and I'm completely clean.

I'm searching for that rare unicorn. I'm searching for an outgoing, smart, fit, emotionally mature woman who wants an amazing friendship first and foremost. But a secret friendship nonetheless. I'm looking for a connection where we can both be free and open to talk about and explore all the things that have been pent up for much too long. A friendship with anticipation and flirting and laughter and fun and travel and shopping and dining and passionate intimate explorations. 

Perhaps you're a career woman or even a stay-at-home mom. You're smart yet curious. You can dress up for a night out or just as easily throw on some sweatpants to cuddle up. You have a great sense of humor. You consider yourself healthy and you take care of your body. Maybe some have even described you as a hopeless romantic. But you're not afraid to express yourself. Whatever the case may be, you're needing more fulfillment in your life. Something that makes your heart race again.

On the outside people view you as having your act together. You have an exceptional head on your shoulders. You get it. However, on the inside and in private, you sneak away to CL from time to time and look. You have that secret side that needs attention and exploring. You want the butterflies. You need to feel alive. And you can only do that with the right man. Guess what... he's out there. And you CAN find him on CL. Maybe you just did. 

I've experienced this in the past, and so I know it's more than possible. But what I've learned is that in order for this to happen successfully there must be a connection of the minds. There needs to be chemistry, respect, trust, and mutual physical attraction. Too many people here are just looking for sex. They forget that the only way to have genuine intimacy and excitement is to have a solid foundation. It's much too important, and it takes a little time to build. 

Look, I don't love the fact that I'm posting an ad on CL, given the reputation of the masses. And you're not the type of woman to typically reply to an ad. But maybe this is the time you finally take that chance. There aren't too many outlets to connect with people in a similar situation. And it's not like we can advertise in public. Discretion is paramount. And if I don't post an ad, I won't have much of a chance in finding you. So do take a few minutes to reply, won't you? You'll be pleasantly surprised to find a guy like me on here. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: Looking for my Asian Sweetheart
text:
I don't drink, I don't smoke, and I don't do drugs. If you're looking for someone to go partying with on Friday nights, you'll have to go look somewhere else. I'm not your guy and I'm alright with that. I'm past that part in my life. I know that at our age, it tends to be a rare trait to find other sober people, but I know there are more people than me that are sober. I am ambitious and I like to keep moving my life and career forward. I'd prefer you have some sort of drive, goals, and ambition too. 
A little bit about me: I'm 24, 6' tall, and white. I've graduated from college and I've started building my career. I tend to be sarcastic and enjoy joking around (I know I probably sounded really serious so far, but I promise I don't take everything seriously). I tend to be a bit of a home body, but because of my dog, I'm rarely on the couch. I want someone to go on walks, exploring, to the zoo and museums with, but still be alright with cuddling on the couch after a long day. I greatly value honesty, loyalty, and respect. I try to treat everyone with respect and just not be a jerk to people. 
I want to bring this up now, so it's not a surprise later. I go to the gym and lift weights at least 3 times a week. I devote a lot of time there. I want you be alright with that and supportive of it. I would prefer if you went also, which would make it time we could bond instead of time spent apart. No, I don't expect you to look like a super model or be as skinny as a rail. I needed the discipline in my life and wanted to stay healthy. 
What I'm looking for in a significant other: I'd like you to be ambitious and educated. I want you to want to do something with your life. I'd like you to be kind and compassionate. I'd like you to be a bit of a homebody and enjoy cuddling on the couch after a long day. I would want you to stay sober. 
I'll do anything for the right person, I'll do everything in my power to keep them happy. I hope you have the same type of attitude, since I'm pretty easy to please to begin with. 
Well, if I sound like someone that interests you, send me an email with your favorite book in the subject line so I know you're a real person. Tell me a bit about yourself and what you're looking for.

title: Sooner or later everyone stops by CL
text:
either for the first time or comes back to it! All the 'paid sites' are what they are to or for you. CL is without a doubt is raw at times & of course there are all the scams, bots & players to contend with but the alternates (eHarmoney, Match, Senior Sexy & whatever else you have tried) aren't any better - there are 1500 sites just like them to choose from. CL definitely has a wider spectrum of readers & posters hence a thinner middle ground.

It's not easy to find a nice & decent woman on CL any more. It used to be. I am not sure why things have changed so but I think it has a lot to do with the single mindedness of some. At least that would be my take after reading a few of the mens postings for Sex, FWB, ONS, married woman, coc shots mailed to womans postings, mom's basement &/or shelter dwellers, druggies &/or alcoholics, it goes on & on. I'm non of that but of course I'd say that after bringing it up.

It never ceases to amaze me what these guys are thinking with? Like women are not interested in sex or have to be reminded & prodded.

That is your first criteria; be proximate to me; Mpls, St Paul or a first tier suburb; a few more criteria would be non smoker, DDF, light drinker, drama free included grand kid child care, a job of your own, filthy rich or retired (aka delusional & own a liquor store - no just kidding - I don't drink ). I need some smarts, articulate & if you have a degree in pillow talk go to the front of the line. I'm not looking to get married again, I've flunked that course once already & don't think I need to take it again.

If you do reply send me enough about yourself that you sound believable or I'm going to "Ghost" you. I don't have the time to spend on those any more than I do on someone who lives outside Mpls, St Paul or a first tier suburb.

The day is not over yet & I've got to get some more stuff done. Maybe later, maybe not.
Your choice, your risk, your decision.
Good Luck with your search.

You are judgmental as fuck. Now, I do mean "you" as in women collectively, but I might as well just say it without quotes, 'cuz more than likely the person who's reading this (YOU) are judgmental as fuck. Not only that, but you're also extremely demanding, and you don't conduct yourself with much pleasantness with how you dole out your rejection and, due to that, you're consequently not very approachable - My day is usually better if I don't even bother fucking with women, 'cuz that's just how horrible the average American woman is, and that fuckin' sucks.

Again, the men taking that route seem to be better examples of men, than those that cater to your shallow bullshit.

But I'm sure you would tell those guys that don't cater to your every whim or go out of their way to impress you by fucking with other people that "They're not a REAL man!" Well, here's the main thing I've come to accept about being a "real man": You don't let anyone make you their bitch - And that includes women. It's also about being secure enough not to let the insults and unrealistic/inconsistent expectations of the opposite sex get to you. And, just so you're aware, you don't know what it's like to be a man, so the next time you feel the need to tell a man "How to be a REAL man", just shut the fuck up instead, okay?

Women as of late have had this undertone of "wanting equality", as modern-day feminism continues to rise, and attempt censor everything and anything, while occasionally ruining the lives of those that oppose them, or high-fiving one another 'bout how 'empowered' they feel when they do something cruel to a man - But that's all a facade. You have no desire for equality, and your victim complex is only your way of putting a veil over your desire to secure more privileges, and have society pander to your every whim, regardless of the kind of person you really are. And it is clearly visible to many men, and it's yet another aspect that has us just shrugging off the upward battle of finding one of you that doesn't show these traits amongst the countless numbers of you that do.

So, if you want a fling, and never really desired anything with any potential for longevity - Feel free to keep being a stuck-up bitch. Tell yourself that all the standards you demand of men, and shamelessly treat those that don't measure up to those standards as less-than-human on a regular basis - Those standards are just you "respecting yourself", right? Ironically, that's what's going to lead you into bed with someone who really doesn't care about you - That just simply 'tolerates you' in order to get what he wants out of you. 'Cuz no reasonable person would want that to be what their tied to for the entirety of their life. But, on the plus side, you can always use your privileged position in society to have a 'keep-a-nigga-baby' and force the guy you're with into either marriage, or to give you a bribe once a month for 18 years!

;D

But, the guys that're worthwhile want TRUE equality. Where we meet, we share what we have, we're not manipulated or forced to change - We just come together, enjoy one anothers' company, and just share good times when we can and help each other make one anothers' lives better each day we can. It's amazing (and depressing) how hard that is to find. My idea of an enjoyable relationship is not being on edge knowing that I need to impress you at all times otherwise you'll leave and go fuck the next guy that caters to your whims marginally better, and yours shouldn't be either.

Which brings us to question 'female nature' overall. I mean, maybe you do subconsciously desire to fuck sociopaths, liars, and manipulators? Maybe you like your relationships to be in a constant state of disarray? Maybe part of the reason you like to date assholes is 'cuz you have a need for conflict, and they make it easy to fulfill that need? Maybe you avoid dating 'nice guys' because they'd reveal how horrible you are by comparison, 'cuz it's much easier to be a bad person next to a bad person and say "See - He's worse, so I'm a 'good person!'", where-as it becomes very clear just how bad of a person you are when you're made to stay with a decent one?

I don't claim to know, but all are a distinct possibility, which is honestly a pretty disgusting reality that men have to face. And due to all that wonderful shit, I oftentimes don't even bother exploring possible relationships.

I know this girl on Facebook that I actually met once. It was a Valentines-themed event (oyyy), so I kinda' made a reference to somethin' I'd seen her post as kind of a joke about how all the guys must be hitting on her, and she kinda' slumped her head, sighed, and said "No..."

Welp, I didn't get much of a chance to talk to her at that event in all honesty (there were alotta' people there, and I wasn't gonna' force anyone out of a conversation, or try to shoe-horn myself into one). But, even though I can see us working out as a couple, just what I've seen of women here, and the fact that, most likely, that's hiding within her, even if I haven't seen that side of her, has made me not bother exploring that.

And that's what I mean when I say the collectively shitty attitude of women overall makes shit fucked for EVERYONE. Maybe her and I would've been an amazing couple? Maybe we'll never know? But, the point is, we might already know by now if I hadn't already been exposed to all the deplorable things that makes up 'the average woman', but that's influencing me to not even try, because it probably won't go anywhere, and it'll probably serve as a reminder of why everything I've written above is true, because I'm almost never proven wrong in that respect.

So, hopefully that gives you some insight as-to how to find a halfway worthwhile guy. The bad news? We're now becoming harder to find. I rarely check craigslist anymore, I'm not signed up for any dating sites, I don't bother trying to talk to random women much anymore, and even when something with potential becomes apparent, I'm hesitant to even invite that disappointment into my life, because that's just how horrible women typically are. Your judgmental demeanor, and those that make up 'your kind' are the reason all that is true. So, this is your guide to understand how your expectations correlate with the kind of guys you're going to meet, and being a stuck-up shallow bitch, then believing you're doing it because you "respect yourself", is going to net you shallow, uncaring guys. But, again - Maybe that's subconsciously what you desire?

title: You're Intelligent, Witty, Fun, Fit, Outgoing, Naughty...and Married
text:
As surprising as it may be, it's possible stumble across an ad that really resonates with you. An ad that genuinely catches your attention. You know immediately that it's different than all the others. And from the onset, you wonder if you should take a chance and reply. Maybe this is one of those ads. And maybe this is the time you finally take that chance.

So who is this guy posting? Well, I'm a very charismatic, charming, witty, and fun guy. I'm educated, professional, accomplished, and I have the ability to effectively communicate my thoughts and feelings better than most men. I'm also married. No games or lies here. But after many years, the relationship has evolved into more of a friendship. We simply grew in different directions. Looking back, I probably married too young and was somewhat naive about what I really wanted. And so I've come to CL hoping to find a woman who might be in a similar boat.

Physically, I'm 5'8" and quite fit. I know guys say they are fit, but still have a gut. Not me. I take care of myself. I watch what I eat and exercise 4-5 days a week. I would describe my body as athletic and well proportioned. I have soft, fair skin, all my hair, nice teeth, and I maintain impeccable hygiene. No tattoos, or piercings, and I'm completely clean.

I'm searching for that very rare unicorn. I'm searching for an outgoing, smart, fit, emotionally mature woman who wants an amazing friendship first and foremost. But a secret friendship nonetheless. I'm looking for a connection where we can both be free and open to talk about and explore all the things that have been pent up for much too long. A friendship with anticipation, flirting, laughter, long conversations, travel, shopping, dining, and passionate intimacy. 

Perhaps you're a career woman or even a stay-at-home mom. You're smart yet curious. You can dress up for a night out or just as easily throw on some sweatpants to cuddle up. You have a great sense of humor. You have a quick wit and appreciate expertly timed sarcasm. You consider yourself healthy and you take care of your body. Maybe some have even described you as a hopeless romantic. But you're not afraid to express yourself. Whatever the case may be, you're needing more fulfillment in your life. Something that makes your heart race again.

On the outside people view you as having your act together. You have an exceptional head on your shoulders. You get it. However, on the inside and in private, you sneak away to CL from time to time and look. You have that secret, naughty side that needs attention and exploring. You want the butterflies. You need to feel alive. And you can only do that with the right man. Guess what... he's out there. And you CAN find him on CL. Maybe you just did. 

I've successfully experienced this in the past, and so I know it's more than possible for two people to meet this way. But what I've learned is that in order for this to happen successfully there must be a connection of the minds. There needs to be chemistry, respect, trust, and mutual physical attraction. Too many people here are just looking for sex. They forget that the only way to have genuine intimacy and excitement is to have a solid foundation. It's much too important, and it takes a little time to build. 

Look, I don't love the fact that I'm posting an ad on CL, given the reputation of the masses. And you're not the type of woman who would ever consider replying. But maybe this is the time you finally take that chance. There aren't too many outlets to connect with people in a similar situation. And it's not like we can advertise in public. Discretion is paramount. And if I don't post an ad, I won't have much of a chance in finding you. So take a moment to reply, won't you? You'll be pleasantly surprised to know that you can find a great guy like me here. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: You're Intelligent, Outgoing, Witty, Attractive, Naughty.. and Married
text:
It's rare, but every once in a while you can stumble upon an ad that really resonates with you. An ad that genuinely catches your attention. You recognize pretty quickly that it's different than all the other ads. And from the onset, you wonder if you should take a chance and reply. Maybe this is one of those ads. And maybe this is the time you finally take that chance.

So who am I? Well, I'm a very charismatic, charming, witty, successful, and funny guy. I'm educated, professional, accomplished, and have the ability to effectively communicate my thoughts and feelings better than most men. I'm also married. No games or lies here. But after many years, the relationship has evolved into more of a friendship. We simply grew in different directions. Looking back, I probably married too young and was somewhat naive about what I really wanted. And so I've come to CL hoping to find a woman who might be in a similar boat.

Physically, I'm 5'8" and quite fit. I take care of myself. I watch what I eat and exercise 4-5 days a week. I would describe my body as athletic and well proportioned. I have soft, fair skin, all my hair, nice teeth, and I maintain impeccable hygiene. No tattoos, or piercings, and I'm completely clean.

I'm searching for that ultra rare unicorn. I'm searching for an outgoing, smart, witty, physically healthy, emotionally mature woman who wants an amazing friendship first and foremost. But a secret friendship nonetheless. I'm looking for a connection where we can both be free and open to talk about and explore all the things that have been pent up for much too long. A friendship with anticipation and flirting and laughter and fun and travel and shopping and dining and long conversations and passionate explorations. 

Perhaps you're a career woman or even a stay-at-home mom. You're smart yet curious. You can dress up for a night out or just as easily throw on some sweatpants to cuddle up. You have a great sense of humor. You consider yourself healthy and you take care of your body. Maybe some have even described you as a hopeless romantic. But you're not afraid to express yourself. Whatever the case may be, you're needing more fulfillment in your life. Something that makes your heart race again.

On the outside people view you as having your act together. You have an exceptional head on your shoulders. You get it. However, on the inside and in private, you sneak away to CL from time to time and look. You have that secret side that needs attention and exploring. You want the butterflies. You need to feel alive. And you can only do that with the right man. Guess what... he's out there. And you CAN find him on CL. Maybe you just did. 

I've experienced this in the past, and so I know it's more than possible. But what I've learned is that in order for this to happen successfully there must be a connection of the minds. There needs to be chemistry, respect, trust, and mutual physical attraction. Too many people here are just looking for sex. They forget that the only way to have genuine intimacy and excitement is to have a solid foundation. It's much too important, and it takes a little time to build. 

Look, I don't love the fact that I'm posting an ad on CL, given the reputation of the masses. And you're not the type of woman to typically reply to an ad. But maybe this is the time you finally take that chance. There aren't too many outlets to connect with people in a similar situation. And it's not like we can advertise in public. Discretion is paramount. And if I don't post an ad, I won't have much of a chance in finding you. So do take a few minutes to reply, won't you? You'll be pleasantly surprised to find a great guy like me on here. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

Physically, I'm 5'8" and quite fit. I know guys say they are fit, but still have a gut. Not me. I take care of myself. I watch what I eat and exercise 4-5 days a week. I would describe my body as athletic and well proportioned. I have soft, fair skin, all my hair, nice teeth, and I maintain impeccable hygiene. No tattoos, or piercings, and I'm completely clean.

Perhaps you're a career woman or even a stay-at-home mom. You're smart yet curious. You can dress up for a night out or just as easily throw on some sweatpants to cuddle up. You have a great sense of humor. You have a quick wit and appreciate expertly timed sarcasm. You consider yourself healthy and you take care of your body. On the outside people view you as having your act together. You have an exceptional head on your shoulders. You get it. However, on the inside and in private, you sneak away to CL from time to time and look. You have that secret, naughty side that needs attention and exploring. You want the butterflies. You need to feel alive. And you can only do that with the right man. Guess what... he's out there. And you CAN find him on CL. Maybe you just did. 

I've successfully experienced this in the past, and so I know it's more than possible for two people to meet this way. But what I've learned is that in order for this to happen successfully there must be a connection of the minds. There needs to be chemistry, respect, trust, and mutual physical attraction. Too many people here are just looking for sex. They forget that the only way to have genuine intimacy and excitement is to have a solid foundation. It's much too important, and it takes a little time to build. 

Look, I don't love the fact that I'm posting an ad on CL, given the reputation of the masses. And you're not the type of woman who would ever consider replying. But maybe this is the time you finally take that chance. There aren't too many outlets to connect with people in a similar situation. And it's not like we can advertise in public. Discretion is paramount. And if I don't post an ad, I won't have much of a chance in finding you. So take a moment to reply, won't you? I look forward to hearing from you!

title: You're Outgoing, Intelligent, Fit, Funny, Naughty ...and Married
text:
It's rare, but every once in a while you can stumble upon an ad that really resonates with you. An ad that genuinely catches your attention. You recognize immediately that it's different than all the others. And from the onset, you wonder if you should take a chance and reply. Maybe this is one of those ads. And maybe this is the time you finally take that chance.

So who am I? Well, I'm a very charismatic, charming, witty, and funny guy. I'm educated, professional, accomplished, and have the ability to effectively communicate my thoughts and feelings better than most men. I'm also married. No games or lies here. But after many years, the relationship has evolved into more of a friendship. We simply grew in different directions. Looking back, I probably married too young and was somewhat naive about what I really wanted. And so I've come to CL hoping to find a woman who might be in a similar boat.

Physically, I'm 5'8" and very fit. I know guys say they are fit, but still have a gut. Not me. I take care of myself. I watch what I eat and exercise 4-5 days a week. I would describe my body as athletic and well proportioned. I have soft, fair skin, all my hair, nice teeth, and I maintain impeccable hygiene. No tattoos, or piercings, and I'm completely clean.

I'm searching for that ultra rare unicorn. I'm searching for an outgoing, smart, witty, physically fit, emotionally mature woman who wants an amazing friendship first and foremost. But a secret friendship nonetheless. I'm looking for a connection where we can both be free and open to talk about and explore all the things that have been pent up for much too long. A friendship with anticipation and flirting and laughter and fun and travel and shopping and dining and long conversations and passionate explorations. 

Perhaps you're a career woman or even a stay-at-home mom. You're smart yet curious. You can dress up for a night out or just as easily throw on some sweatpants to cuddle up. You have a great sense of humor. You consider yourself healthy and you take care of your body. Maybe some have even described you as a hopeless romantic. But you're not afraid to express yourself. Whatever the case may be, you're needing more fulfillment in your life. Something that makes your heart race again.

On the outside people view you as having your act together. You have an exceptional head on your shoulders. You get it. However, on the inside and in private, you sneak away to CL from time to time and look. You have that secret side that needs attention and exploring. You want the butterflies. You need to feel alive. And you can only do that with the right man. Guess what... he's out there. And you CAN find him on CL. Maybe you just did. 

I've experienced this in the past, and so I know it's more than possible. But what I've learned is that in order for this to happen successfully there must be a connection of the minds. There needs to be chemistry, respect, trust, and mutual physical attraction. Too many people here are just looking for sex. They forget that the only way to have genuine intimacy and excitement is to have a solid foundation. It's much too important, and it takes a little time to build. 

Look, I don't love the fact that I'm posting an ad on CL, given the reputation of the masses. And you're not the type of woman to typically reply to an ad. But maybe this is the time you finally take that chance. There aren't too many outlets to connect with people in a similar situation. And it's not like we can advertise in public. Discretion is paramount. And if I don't post an ad, I won't have much of a chance in finding you. So do take a few minutes to reply, won't you? You'll be pleasantly surprised to find a great guy like me on here. 

I look forward to hearing from you!

title: ISO a tall chick with long legs who will agree with everything I say
text:
A man walks into a restaurant with a full-grown ostrich behind him. The waitress asks them for their orders. The man says, "A hamburger, fries and a coke" and turns to the ostrich "What's yours?" "I'll have the same," says the ostrich. A short time later the waitress returns with the order. "That will be $9.40 please." The man reaches into his pocket and pulls out the exact change for payment.
The next day the man and the ostrich come in again and the man says "A hamburger, fries and a coke." The ostrich says "I'll have the same." Again the man reaches into his pocket and pays with exact change.

This becomes the routine until the two enter on Friday. "The usual?" asks the waitress. "No, this is Friday night, so I'll have a steak, baked potato and a salad," says the man."Same," says the ostrich. Shortly the waitress brings the order and says, "That will be $32.62." Once again the man pulls the exact change out of his pocket and places it on the table.

The waitress cannot hold back her curiosity any longer. "Excuse me, sir. How do you manage to always come up with the exact change in your pocket every time?" "Well," says the man, "several years ago I was cleaning out the attic and found an old lamp. When I rubbed it, a Genie appeared and offered me two wishes. My first wish was that if I ever had to pay for anything, I would just put my hand in my pocket and the right amount of money would always be there." 

"That's brilliant!" says the waitress. "Most people would ask for a million dollars or something, but you'll always be as rich as you want for as long as you live!" "That's right. Whether it's a gallon of milk or a Rolls Royce, the exact money is always there," says the man. The waitress asks, "What's with the ostrich?" The man sighs, pauses and answers, "My second wish was for a tall chick with a big ass and long legs who would agree with everything I say.........."

title: Intelligent nerd looking for love.
text:
I've been sitting here for twenty minutes trying to figure out how to write this without sounding generic, and I've been failing amazingly at it. I keep writing and rewriting, and I still can't seem to put the right words together. Other people here seem to know exactly what they want. Some at least have an idea. Some write small novels. Others still are satisfied putting just the basics. And the rest, well, they're in the flipping wrong category anyway. 

I'm looking for the right person. That's all I'm looking for. 

I want someone who I can laugh with, talk about nothing for hours with. I want someone who can understand me for who I am, and who I strive to be. I want someone who I have that connection that need not be spoken. I want someone who I can listen to, someone who can confide in me, just as I hope to be able to confide in them. I'm a romantic at heart, and, thing is, I'm the sort of person that thinks with his heart a lot of the time. 

See how I had that issue with sounding generic, cheesy? That sounded like a card or something, even though it was true. 

The simple facts? I'm in school full time, third shift mostly. I like my job, even with its ups and downs. I drive, own my own vehicle, don't live with my parents. Shorter hair, hazel eyes, glasses, fit. Working on getting ink'd. I'm the sort that believes that chivalry is not dead, just needs to be modernized. (Made sense, I swear.). Also, here is the kicker.....I live in Sioux Falls, SD. It's a 3 hour drive; however, if things became serious...I would make the drive weekly.

I'm a gamer. I'm a geek. Super geek. Not basement-dwelling geek. Just. Geek. I can be a goofball at times. (Favorite shows? Supernatural, Doctor Who, Firefly & more. Favorite Games? Mass Effect, Skyrim, and so many more.) Yeah, I play Dungeons and Dragons, but I don't dress in chain mail and throw bean bags at people yelling out spells. Though now that I type that out, it sounds sort of random and fun. All around geek/nerd here. 

What I'm looking for is to meet someone, hopefully have it turn into something more. I'm not one for friends with benefits, nor casual encounters. I'm looking for a best friend, my partner in crime, and all those things. Cuddles are nice too, just, ah, saying. Honestly too, looks, do matter to me. But I love people for who they are. I do hope, though, to find a fellow geek, or someone who has somewhat similar interests as I do. 

Please if you respond put your favorite show or game in the title, and tell me a bit about you. One line responses won't get replies, sorry. I took the time to write all this, I hope to get a bit from you too. I will want to text for a while, just to talk and such, so if I respond I'll send my number. Pic for pic and all that.

title: How are we feeling?
text:
Hello, 
So, I have been reading the posts from married men looking for married women. Because I was trying to get an idea of what to say in mine. And the men all sound so desperate. It's the same thing. "We lost the passion, the romance, I feel like were just roommates". I get it, most of us that are married and looking on CL, men and women, probably do feel that way. But, man can we get a little more articulate, or creative or maybe even just bit more honest? At least pretend to be happy. I feel like I should respond to these guys and try talking them off the ledge. :)

Okay, yes, I feel all of those things too. So I'm just going to say what excites me about posting here. I get excited when I connect with someone. Someone that's not afraid to share whatever comes to their mind. I get excited to see an email in my inbox from that person. I'll admit that it puts a little bounce in my step and makes my day a little brighter. I feel good knowing that person is looking for my email too. And yes, I would like to meet someone and have some fun with. Hopefully we hit it off, laugh and look forward to getting emails and just keeping it low key. Is this more of a rant than a post?

I'm a nice looking guy. Working professional. I take care of myself and eat right. But I wouldn't pass up a plate of wings either. But most of all, I'm very normal. I'm just missing a little of that human touch. (Can you name the song/artist)

I hope to hear from someone that knows where I'm coming from. :)

title: What if you're an imperfect person?
text:
When I read what others have written in this space, it makes me wonder if anyone values individuality. Everyone paints themselves as passionate and dedicated, yet totally laid back. Most people can't be all things, so you lose credibility by claiming the impossible. I've always wondered why everyone fears to be more candid. We all have various issues. Do people think they'll be able to successfully hide their blemishes forever? Why not present yourself accurately and take the pressure off of having to maintain a perpetual facade?

I consider myself to be a fairly desirable fellow in some respects, but I also understand there are things that would turn many women off. It's okay though because I'm not looking to attract all women; one really nifty gal is all it takes! Problem number one is that I'm poor. For whatever reasons, I don't have money so that takes most dating prospects out of the picture, which I accept. I've also never seen myself as a parent. Not feeling sure that I could be a proper father, I've chosen not to have kids. That's weird to some, but to me it seems like a reasonable decision.

Sometimes I get very uncomfortable in public and become quiet. Making chit-chat with strangers is torture. Crowded restaurants are very unnerving and not where I'd go for a good time. What it says about me I'm not sure, but generally if everyone tends to go en masse to anywhere, I'll hate it there. Having the place to myself (or ourselves) is when I'm most at ease and fun. 

In comfortable settings, I love to have long rhetorical debates on inconsequential topics. I'm handy and can perform most home-improvement tasks. My clothes end up filthy on a surprisingly high percentage of days. My music collection is impeccable because I've devoted a huge amount of time to that over the years. My political views are largely libertarian and I constantly urge people to consider things from an opposing perspective. I rely on my own observations, not popular belief.

So perhaps I'm not an ideal mate for most. I've looked at the lives of "normal" people and truly don't see the appeal. Even my best friends who've done everything by the book don't seem any better off. In fact they look stressed-out beyond belief. That's not the life I want. For me, having a girl pal to laugh and wrestle with sometimes would be terrific. The goal for me is to meet an interesting person, hopefully learn some things from her, and be glad we know each other without obsessing over our compliance to social norms.

If you'd like to vent about your quirks or share a short story with me, please do. If there's going to be any romantic intent with it, know that I'm a not bad-looking dude and will hoping to break even in that respect. If you're only writing to tell me to grow up, at least spell check it before sending.

title: Disappointed
text:
The Original Question's From Some Woman I Saw Here Was
"Why can't men do their manly dating duty by asking a woman out if he's attracted to her?"
"Why do men have to date several women to find the right one?"

I will answer them with the real truth

There are two kinds of men

First, there is the chase a conquest, have sex, then sabotage or dump her type

This type chases after anything with two boobs and a wet vagina. This sort of boy (I cannot refer to them as being men) goes after women as a sport due to ego, emotional incompleteness, and notches on the bedpost. Bragging rights as if still mentally in high school so as to speak. This type is a well polished actor, usually from many years of practice. He will say and do just about anything in the beginning to get what he wanted from the start. Sex. Once he gets that for a very short time he is going to dump the girl for a fresher conquest. Much like a dog chasing a moving toy. Often this type is seeing more than one at the same time..(emotionally incomplete girl's do this even more than males),and with the internet and this is very easy to do. The girl who falls for this type of guy is usually just as shallow herself, seeking only sex, and often not caring or recognizing her repeated mistakes. She goes for shiny things and sales pitches like the stupid girl that she really is. She usually will place all blame on all men for her own bad mistakes or bad behavior, becoming more angry and jaded with each subsequent boy she opens her legs for, after being fed the sales pitch lines from the conquest seeker. These boys and girls are the most pathetic in our modern society, and as a result the girls whine and the boys simply move on to the next one. They are both filled with so much drama that most of the energy is spent defending that drama. Neither the conquest seeker, or the girl have much self respect.

Then there are men like myself.

We have loved before. I am a widower. We men are exposed constantly to modern shallow superficial females who are trying to get through life on looks alone as if they have nothing more to offer. We see those other jaded and bitter whiners as stupidly funny due to their lack of understanding themselves and the real men. They hang around the conquest seekers and as a result have no idea there are good men out there. Why? Because they themselves have become blind to the good men who may be looking for someone of more real value.They in fact no longer even trust themselves, so there is no way they will ever trust any man...unless that man (always a conquest seeker) gives her a great big sales pitch.

As a result, the conquest seeker goes about his daily chase routine while the good men just quietly give up and come to a reckoning that they will either be alone in the future, or they will settle for the less than a very good respectable woman, usually in fear of being alone.

You wanted an answer...Enough said.

Oh, Forgot to give a blunt more direct answer for the women online who just don't get it yet with the previous answer

Good men do not approach most pretty and attractive women here, or in person, based on the logical assumption that she is getting approached every ten minutes by someone else with a sales pitch anyway. We do know better. We also know that most likely, if she is that very good respectable woman who has self respect, she is happily and loyally seeing someone already or married. We know that if an attractive woman has made it all the way down to the depths of the internet looking for men, that she is actually demonstrating to all men that she views herself as flat out too good for every man who has ever approached her face to face so we don't bother. These pathetic women overvalue themselves to the point of being snobbish and fairly rude to men in the process.

Females in this modern time do not really want men anyway. They want a male doormat to serve them. I think most of them are happiest alone, as they should be. It would cut down on illegitimate kids being born out of lust and flings. Added to that, women say they are so independent these days, which reads as a great big stay away sign to men like me. I know that if they really wanted a man..... they would assert themselves instead of acting like the insecure wallflowers that they really are while stupidly pretending to be confident, but aren't at all. If they were, they would assert. Only boys fall for this sort of female.

The times are changed forever. Men are no longer allowed to be men. Women usually want everything from men and offer nothing back.
I have a saying that is very true these days.....

"Take away that overvalued vagina and is there anything left to offer a man?"

Most women these days have no idea what that even means, or do get it ..and instead of understand a man's point of view, they instead choose to get all pissed off if a man says it. These sorts of women are pathetic, and real losers because the saying really hits them where it hurts. The truth. But nevertheless, it is true. Most women these days have nothing of value left with the way they behave. Women need to remember one very important thing here. As men get older, they also get wiser and no longer need women as much as women need men. If it weren't for men, what would women do? Most would turn to other women because most have the primary objective of sex, at just about any cost including the loss of self respect...under the stupid disguise of "I want a relationship". Why? Because they choose blame all men for their own stupid behavior patterns.

I certainly am not attracted to your green hair, ten tattoos, and the hardware store hanging off the face and tongue.
I happen to like real ladies like my own wife was. Not men with two breasts and a smelly vagina.

Slowly, women in society with bad behavior are losing the respect of good men. I think most women found online are just plain nuts. I think most women online are validation seekers.

Am I angry? Nope. I am disappointed in the behaviors of modern women.
This is not an ad looking for a woman from the online world of Romper Room. It is a goodbye.

your tears gushing, soaking his white tee.

It interests you, doesn't it?

Perhaps you just want his love, 
his kind voice,
and the peace you know you can find

or the punishing yet judicious hand
you now so strongly desire,

pet your pretty hair,
and tell you what a good girl you are.
Whatever it is that you desire my darling,
you will find this man open,

You will also find him well educated,
